Service was friendly and the entrees came swiftly after we finished the appetizers. 
As we hurriedly left the restaurant to go to the Metreon, we already were thinking about coming back to try the other dishes. With all the movies coming out in the summer, we will be back for sure.
author: lovetoeat a.

description:
Food, service, ambience - all five stars.
Highly recommend daily specials, grilled salmon.
author: Neha H.

description:
This is so far my favorite restaurant in SF at the moment. The interior decor is beautiful, all the waitresses and staff were so nice and friendly, drinks are delicious, and then the food is beautiful and taste AMAZING. What more can you ask for. This place was so good I already came here twice lol. 
- My absolute favorite is the Kobe Beef with Sticky Rice. The Beef is so flavorful along with its chili dip and then balanced with the bouncy texture of the sticky rice is just PERFECTION!I literally think about this dish all the time.
- The coconut juice here is fresh and is served right in the coconut. Sweet and refreshing.
- I know most people rave about the mango shaved ice which is delicious but you should also try the chocolate soufflé cake with Thai ice tea ice cream. 

Probably going to come back here soon again :D
author: Young L.

description: We stopped by Friday night and could only get a small table near the door. It was a cold and breezy San Francisco night, so that wouldn't work. So, we made reservations for the next night, hopefully for a table away from the door. When we returned, they sat us near the other door.  The waitress was very friendly but was inattentive and continued to make mistakes. I had to ask twice for a fork for my wife. The brought me soup, but no spoon. Shocker!  The portion sizes were very small and yet, very expensive.  Yes, the place is very trendy and hip, but I am a little old for lazy service.
author: Scotty B.

description: Wow this place is hip and their bathrooms are so clean and stylish.  Very good place to hang out on happy hours or any hours.
author: Tony W.

description: I love Happy hour  Oyster just only $1 , with wine and champagne , Lao food's Delicious & Fantastic , great texture, i love this place.
author: Supalerk L.

description:
Decor: Pleasant balance of modern and traditional decor in dining and bar area, and space has an open and communal feeling. Loved the purple hued lamps hanging all the way down the center of the dining room. 

Appetizers: FRESH SPRING ROLLS (Fresh rice paper wrapper + pork sausage + Vietnamese mint + Laotian peanut dip) and LAO SAUSAGE (Laotian style pork sausage served with fresh ginger + toasted peanut). There were three of us sharing and this was enough for all three. Both of these apps were very good, but the Lao sausage was everyone's favorite.

Entrees: Again, there were three of us sharing these three dishes and we were not able to finish as the serving sizes are generous. MOK SEABASS (Chilean sea bass W/ red curry custard + banana blossom + holy basil + jasmine rice) and "LARB ZEEN" BEEF LETTUCE WRAP (Spicy flank beef lettuce wrap + toasted ground rice + soft herbs) and TOTALLY PRAWNS (Coconut milk red curry + fresh tiger prawns + pineapple + lychee W/ toasted peanut).  All three of these entrées were very tasty, but the prawns were everyone's favorite. The Seabass had some deep, dark flavors, which were unexpected but very good. The beef lettuce wrap had a lighter flavor than we expected, but also very good. The prawns had savory, sweet, salty and umami flavors all going on in a beautiful balance, plus it was the most visually pleasing of the three dishes.

Service was also very good. The servers were soft-spoken but attentive, and happy to assist us with ordering by making recommendations for popular and/or traditional dishes.
author: Deborah S.

description: Come here on a Tuesday day noon with friends. Great food, very pretty layout, great atmosphere and service. A little bit pricey compared to fast lunch around, but worth it. A good example of fine dining, love it
author: Li X.

description: Great food. Service was a little slow and wait staff temperament was questionable though not offensive. Will def return.
author: Sally A.

description:
I had Lao Table for the first time a few weeks ago. Im a huge fan of Lao cuisine and its so nice to see more of this type of cuisine popping up in the city.  

I ordered the Papaya Salad Lao style and it was incredible! The presentation was so colorful and beautiful. I actually never had papaya salad Lao style before, but it was exactly what I imagined it would be. Stinky, Fermented, and SPICY. Woo! So delicious!

Please please please dont ever lower the spicy-level of this salad! I love it! I can't wait to come back.
author: Emi K.

description:
Right after I came here for the first time and didn't have a great experience, Kitty, the General Manager, reached out and offered her apologies and the chance to come again (complements of the restaurant).

I came for lunch and the experience was night and day to the first time around. Service was on point, and they really went out of their way to make sure that this time my guest and I had a great experience. Food was good (had the spring rolls, crab noodle curry, and panang beef curry).

Really appreciate the level of customer service and responsiveness from Kitty and the team and look forward to coming here again in the future (on my company's budget because its a little pricey!)
author: Laura D.

description: While the food continues to be decent (especially the lamb dish, although pricey), the service was beyond terrible on this last visit.  They completely disregarded the fact I had a reservation, then when we pointed out we were waiting for 15 plus minutes while they were seating people without reservations, we were offered an awful bar location that was free the entire time we were there.  Finally 20 mins into our reservation time, we were seated.  It took 45 mins to get our meal and we had to rush through to get back to work for a meeting.  Our dishes arrived and we had to ask for basic cutlery which took 10 minutes to get while our food just sat at the table unable to be eaten ... and so on and so on.  At least they smiled.  I wouldn't return based upon the poor service which is unfortunate since I come here for work lunches often.
author: Ed J.

description:
If you like authentic Northeastern Thai style food I would like you to come to this restaurant. The staffs are friendly. 
Highly recommended for fine dining experience.
author: Phannia W.

description:
That was very good and really good. I must admit. My third time here. It was an incredible yummy and perfect amount of food to share for two.
-Gai Yang Bbq chicken
-Lao Fried Rice
-Koi Tuna Tartar 
-Pineapple Millionaire to die for.
Again, that was so good and really good
author: Busarin K.

description: Got lunch here again with a group of friends. This time we ordered family style and shared all the dishes. I love the eggplant wok dish and their delicious fried rice noodles! I need to try out one of their soups next time. Great spice and lovely service. All around thumbs up :)
author: Angel C.

description: Service is a bit slow, but the food and vibe were both really nice. It's a great spot for groups -- not super crowded, not too noisy.
author: Theodora C.

description: I have been to Laos dinner and both time are amazing. Drinks are delicious and food is very good. Today is my 3rd time and it is for Happy Hour. The $1 oyster is super great. We also ordered calamari, wings and beef jerky. The beef jerky particular is yummy, juicy and with spicy sauce is just perfect. Definitely will come back again.
author: Suki C.

description:
I had crispy sticky rice for my dinner and of course Thai ice tea at Lao Table. The food was really good. I asked them for the most spicy level for my food and they surprised me with this authentic, super spicy yet delicious. I'm so glad I found this restaurant and will definitely come back for more food!
Cheers!
author: Piaw K.

description: My friend and I walked a mile to find this place in the rain. It was authentic and so delicious. The Lao sausage (always with sticky rice) was my favorite and they serve it how a Laotian person would eat it with all the extra sides (sliced garlic, peanuts, etc.).  I highly recommend this place. Beautiful atmosphere and great service too.
author: Sao S.

description: Definitely the place to hangout plus friendly service make you feel like home, I love BBQ chicken, soft and tender.. yum yum!!! I
author: Wiza S.

description: Great meal!  I was very impressed with the place.  Went to lunch here with a colleague and it was very very good.  Expensive!  But worth it.  The tea was wonderful, not too sweet.  The red curry chicken was awesome and had a good spice to it.  Loved the noodles.  Had the fresh rolls to start and they were very very good too.  I'll be going back for sure.  Tip:  make a reservation...it gets very crowded even for lunch.
author: Mar H.

description: slightly pricey for Laotian food even for SF.  I had the pork rice plate for lunch, which was a little tasty (although sauce did not pack enough heat). The spring roll appetizer was soft and fresh.  Get there before noon and you should be able to get a table.
author: John P.

description:
Sometimes I think fancier the decor tries to make up for the lack of flavor at Thai food places. I was excited to try this trendy modern looking restaurant, but the food was not up to par with even some of the other cheaper sketchier restaurants in the city, and definitely did not meet expectation to the flavors I've found at some fancier Thai restaurants in the past. 

Khan Kai noodles 2.5/5: this was the closest to pad seew that they offered, but were unable to substitute the chicken for beef. There were also peanuts on top which was more reminiscent of what I would prefer in pad Thai. The sauce was also lackluster in moisture and flavor. I like more soy sauce in my noodles. A good portion size for the price, easily enough to split with a friend. 

Pineapple fried rice 4/5: the highlight of the meal. This was a very traditional Thai pineapple fried rice, solid, but nothing I haven't seen before. It was good mainly because it outshined the others, as a standalone plate compared to other restaurants, it was still lacking. Great portion size for the price. 

Thai iced tea 2/5: huge glass mainly to hold the exuberant amount of crushed ice. A bit overwhelming with the milky flavor with an infusion of tea 

Bamboo salad 3/5: ornate presentation in a hanging basket, otherwise underwhelming in complexity (all the ingredients were just piled next to one another), and lacking in any complex flavors, mainly comprised of a few raw ingredients and little dressing. 

TLDR: This was a meet in the middle experience - nice ambiance like some of the more expensive Thai places I've been, but mediocre food that seemed non-traditional, but didn't have enough of an oomph to satisfy me with a unique crossover or fusion cuisine. Would have opted for a more traditional experience.
author: Kathy T.

description:
Now that Lao Table is open, I don't have to drive across the bay to enjoy great Lao food.  I recommend ordering several dishes and share with everyone as opposed to each person getting their own entree, that way you can try so many different things!

My FAVORITE so far is the papaya salad (Lao style), served with sides of pork meat loaf, shrimps, hard boiled eggs, pork rinds, vermicelli noodles and fresh seasonal vegetables (just like how it is served in Laos).  It is a meal if it's own and very satisfying. Also, tried their miang pla (make your own fish wrap), and heavenly beef (beef jerky) which did not disappoint.

Can't wait to go back and try their other dishes!
author: Manola B.

description: Getting a table wasn't an issue, but the service is horrible! This was at 1pm when it should be busy but I only see about 3 waiters while there were 3-4 greeters standing around. No one came after sitting over 15 mins and trying to wave someone down is impossible. After finally asking one busy looking waiter, he took our order! The food actually came out fast but overall it was just ok for the price we paid. I never had Lao food but this still tasted very similar to Osha Thai when it was there and nothing more special. The presentation of the food is nice but still very overrated place that I do not care on coming back.
author: Karen H.

description:
Everything I had are delicious and spicy!!!! The portion and price are very good . Flavor is very refreshing, each dish are very uninque and have fancy presentation. My favorite is the Tum Marg Hoong. It is amazing flavor..
My first review with first time with Laotian food??
author: Pimlapat L.

description: Great decor accompanied with friendly staff and delicious food. The whole experience is so beautiful. Food presentation is like a colorful tropical paradise painting.
author: Exchael A.

description:
I came here for lunch to celebrate my wedding on valentine, I would recommend Lao table for dinner or lunch, this place is the best food ever and very beautiful decoration inside, and very good service and great welcome from  May and Manager Kristy, 
I love all food especially Papaya salad and BBQ chicken is my favorite   
And dessert was awesome lao table 
Thanks you Kristy we love you
author: Phommalysack P.

description:
This is where you go if you want pricier noodles. I love noodles. 

I would only come here if I wanted to splurge and I had to stay in SoMa, because there are so many other great, cheap ethnic restaurants elsewhere where I can get similar food. 

But they do have $1 oysters and a big portion of noodles.
author: Ke D.

description: I had a fantastic meal at Lao Table, and I can't wait to go back to enjoy the place with more friends and family. I love the atmosphere and friendly staff who gave excellent recommendations. Everything was plated beautifully.
author: Mark S.

description: Went here for a MetroWize event that my friend complained about. We got two free drink tickets. I got Thai iced tea and a Pineapple Millionaire. They had too much ice. I got a basil chicken dish and that was pretty good, but it was overpriced. I don't like overpriced Thai food unless it's soooo good. Nice atmosphere. I don't know how this is different from Osha Thai...same owner.
author: Denise C.

description: Went here with coworkers yesterday and had the beef pho.  Afterwards, didn't feel well the entire day and threw it all up during the night.  This is only the 2nd time ever that I've gotten food poisoning and it was horrible.  Not coming back here again.
author: Tony C.

description:
Used to come to this same location when it was OSHA Thai. Lao Table has more taster menu. Our waiter let us order from happy hour special. We had the calamari and chicken wings from HH deal. $6-8 was a Great deal!   

We had the banana blossom salad (which isn't my favorite).  

Prawn curry - we loved! The flavors worked really well!

Wok fried pork belly- the pork was a bit rough to chew on. 

Eggplant and tofu dish was on point! 

The atmosphere is a bit more louder. We had to scream across the table to converse. The background music was club-like and lights got dimmer as the evening went on.
author: Theresa H.

description: Amazing service and extremely authentic, flavorful dishes. We asked the staff for their recommendations and could not be happier that we did. These people are legitimate connoisseurs of their craft. We will definitely come back again. Great quality food.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Reserved a table with Yelp Reservations before coming, so there was no wait (Thanks Yelp Res!). The inside looked really bougie and high end. The lighting was very dim and the ambiance was great for conversations. 

We ordered the two items the menu recommended: Crispy Sticky Rice Salad and Lao Sausage. They tasted amazing. The Rice Salad was eaten using the lettuce which gave it even more of a crisp. You could even put the Lao Sausage on top of the lettuce + sticky rice combo! Be warned though, the two dishes were fairly spicy.
author: Aaron O.

description:
False advertising on happy hour $1 oysters.
I was all excited to order some oysters before our dinner and was told happy hour only served in the bar area after the waitress sat our group in the dining room. There is a big sign in front of the restaurant that advertises happy hour 5-7pm and $1 oysters and no where does it say in the bar area only.
Totally disappointed. Not going to come here anymore!
author: Maria R.

description: A great place with beautiful decor, clean spaces, and very friendly staff. The food though, that really takes the prize! The Pad Pha Beef and the lamb curry are to die for! Glad I found this place today with my friend.
author: Helen K.

description:
I've been to Lao Table before and it was decently good if overpriced. This last time I came I got the Tom Yum Fries, Om Chicken, and Mark Mango. I kept ordering dishes to my detriment because I remember it being good and I kept wanting something tasty because I was so hungry but I just ended up hungry and $50 poorer.

Not a universal bashing of the restaurant but would absolutely not recommend those dishes.
author: Laura N.

description: Tasty food, mix of Thai, Vietnamese and Laotian flavors.... the color, presentation, smell all come together in this beautiful combination.  A bit pricey compared with similar quality food in traditional SJ restaurants.  Worth it for the location and ambience.
author: Eddie T.

description:
Happened to be working in the city and decided that this place sounded interesting. 

Pros: amazing food and great variety. It was Fresh, well balanced flavors, delicious. As one might expect from Laotian/Thai/Vietnamese food. We sat at the bar which was fun and tempting. Their cocktails look interesting! Unfortunately, I'm a responsible person and had to drive soon. No drinks for me. :-(

Cons: only one. Got a Vietnamese coffee that was MUCH different than what I am used to. Unsweetened and the milk was evaporated. No sweetened condensed milk? Weird! But, it was only a very minor con.

Would go again, highly recommended!
author: Simonne A.

description: Love the presentation on all items on the menu. Not super authentic but was still good. Cute decor!!! Service could of been a little better,but staff was friendly. Thank god cuz Osha is a fail!!!! On the pricier side for Laotian food but what do you expect in the financial district. Great place for a bday dinner or even just dessert. Plenty of space to cater to big parties as well.
author: Theresa M.

description:
This place had the makings of a great Thai restaurant, but missed the mark on several fronts. Firstly, it took 20 minutes to take a drinks order - on the long side but excusable as a one off, the restaurant was very busy. The first bit of food to arrive came at the 45 minute mark, and it was a papaya salad which we'd ordered to come with the main course. The salad was fresh and spicy, excellent in fact, but seemed completely of place. After prompting the waiter another 10 minutes later some appetisers arrived. The wings and pork belly, both excellent but stone cold (no exaggeration, they weren't even warm). All we could put this down to was the waiting staff. How can food be both slow and cold? It's sitting around somewhere too long.

The theme continued to the main courses - which tasted excellent but were cold. I almost sent it back but by the time we were asked about the food I had lost my appetite. Overall, I won't be going back. In a city like SF there is too much choice for these very basic errors to be forgivable.
author: Tom R.

description: The food is good!! Also love the ambience at thiS place.  we surprised my sister in law here, had flowers and balloon delivered for her that the manager was able to help set up.  Super nice staff.  The only draw back was that its a bit pricey for Laos food.
author: mary d.

description:
I'm in love here! 

Food (mango with fish sauce, garlic chicken wings hellllllo! Beef jerky) omfg...food is off the hook! Tasty and good price...just saying. Don't play!

Bestest waiter and owner here. They are friendly and nice and kind and bathroom is clean! Meet me here now
author: Vee V.

description:
Sabaidee, I'm no stranger to the Lao Peoples Democratic Republic yet I have never had foods anything like this.  Do they really have "haute cuisine?" I can't say enough how very please my group and I are with the informative and attentive service we experienced yesterday.  

The restaurant with its high-end appeal is not at all typical Lao. They have a full bar and a wonderful dining room atmosphere beneath hundreds of brass bells, three large temple bells and lantern like fixtures all hanging overhead.

At $13.95 their daily lunch special is a great value for one in this part of town. I'd recommend coming with a group and enjoying several unfamiliar dishes relaxed, family style. 
 
At $12.95 the Lao Sausage appetizer with ginger, onion and nicely toasted peanuts was surprisingly juicy and zesty while the $14.95 Zeen Ping/Grilled Steak cubes marinated in lemongrass with a chili-lime dipping sauce were tender and refreshingly different.

At $17.95 the Red Curry Chicken in coconut milk with its perfectly prepared apple eggplants and basil had a taste and quality to match its price. And, at $19.00 the Tom Laab Lao/Braised Pork Rib Laotian sour soup was a delicious and obvious relative of Tom Yum. 

The favorite of our table was the $31.95 Kha Moo German/Pork knuckle on a bed of sautéed cabbage. With a crispy skin exterior and succulent interior this amazing entrée is designed to share. No knife needed as it just flakes off the bone. 

We concluded our meal with assorted berries, fruits and a scoop of coconut ice cream on ice, mmmm.
author: Caesar A.

description:
I actually came here for lunch one day with my coworkers and had no idea this place was owned by Osha Thai! We made a reservation since we were a group of 8, but it didn't seem too busy when we got there so it might have been fine if we went without one. We got sat at a large table right by the door, but for some reason didn't all get menus which was fine since we were about 2-3 less people than our original reservation.

One waiter took our orders but, I'm not sure if it was that he didn't really understand English or if he just wasn't paying attention, there ended up being some weird mix up in orders. My coworker and I both ordered pho which came out later than all the other orders, and someone brought out a fried rice dish that no one at the table had ordered. When we said no one had ordered that and we were just waiting for our pho, she kept circling the table as though she didn't believe us and knew the dish was someone's...so weird!

Overall, the food was fine (not too different from Osha Thai), but I was really surprised by the plating of the pho and how big it was! They brought out a giant bowl on top of a bamboo tray with a small bowl of basil, bean sprouts, lime, and jalapenos, and it was definitely a lot of food for one person. I was pretty hungry but I wasn't able to finish it! The short rib broth tasted pretty good and the short rib itself was tender and delicious. I would come back again if I was with a big group and wanted a quick meal.

My only pet peeve was that they had 3 TVs above the bar directly in front of me playing the same channel...but each one was about 5 seconds off from the other so it was really distracting and made my OCD go crazy x_x
author: Grace C.

description:
This place is delicious, a must try! It's relatively new, definitely an upgrade from Osha. Lao food with a modern twist! This earned a spot in both my lunch and dinner rotation since it's near my office and it's ridiculously good especially for the price.

They also have dope towelettes and tea, both are magical AF.

Sea bass: 5/5
Kobe beef: 5/5
Papaya salad: 4/5
Red Curry: 5/5
Grilled calamari: 3/5

Butterfly tea: 5/5 SO COOL

I recommend the Kobe and Sea bass for sure. The amount of top quality and flavorful meat and fish you get for the price is amazing and actually filled up the bottomless pit that is my stomach.

Service was excellent as well! No one judged me for being annoying and taking pics/vids.

COME HERE NOW
author: Cecille R.

description:
so i got this place from yelp and i went for a drink with a friend
it was over all ok but the bathroom was out of paper...:/
very pretty design and nice staff!
author: Anne C.

description: Amazing for a nice lunch!! Awesome vegetarian options and my meat eating friends also were raving about their dishes. If you like spicy, be sure to ask for the spicy sauce. You can't go wrong ordering anything but if you are in doubt, ask the server. They are happy to recommend. The place is a little expensive in comparison but for that food, it's worth the splurge. Will be coming back.
author: Poornima R.

description:
have walked by here many times and never stopped in. had lunch here last week and liked it so much went back the next day! definitely recommend reservations at lunch, it's packed

one of the reviews I read said Laotian food was like Thai but not spicy so when I asked for a curry dish very spicy I thought it would be normal spicy. yikes was I wrong haha it was great though

huge menu of soups, noodle bowls, salads and entrees. I've had two of the curries and both were great

it's a bit expensive, so not an every day lunch place, but it will definitely be added to my rotation
author: Bob U.

description:
Great food. Great atmosphere. Actually vegetarian friendly. Waiter asked about eggs and fish sauce when taking my order which is pretty rare. Definitely coming back here. 

Recommend the khaw kai noodles.
author: Mona P.

description:
I was a bit hesitant about trying this place since it had fairly mediocre reviews, but I'm glad that I tried this out - it was great!

We had a few different items from their menu and everything was unique and tasted very good:

Crispy Sticky Rice Salad
Khaw Kai Noodles
Gang Beef

The sticky rice salad was definitely a unique dish with a ton of flavor, especially from the fish sauce.  Eating it wrapped in the accompanying lettuce and other vegetables, it really became a balanced dish.  The noodles were excellent with a ton of flavor and really left me satisfied.  The beef was also well seasoned and cooked to a perfect tenderness.

This place opened/re-opened not too long ago and when I was there it felt like they were still trying to figure a few things out since the service was a bit slow at first, but eventually improved.

If you're looking for unique food, try this place!
author: Ken G.

description:
I prefer the seating set-up now to what it used to be as Osha Thai - it feels less crowded and the decor and seats themselves are more comfortable. 

I'm not an expert but I couldn't discern what was different or distinctive about the Laotian, as opposed to Thai, food. I would have liked more information on the menu. I found the appetizers a little disappointing - the fresh and the crunchy spring rolls were pretty bland and the chicken satay had a slightly weird texture.

The main courses were a bit better. I had the special of the day, mainly because the half chicken came with papaya salad and sticky rice. The salad had a nice kick but the chicken was not very tasty. The curries looked better, although we missed the pumpkin curry! We sent a lamb dish back for being REALLY underdone (not rare but raw), and it came back to our liking.

However, the desserts were excellent, enormous and really interesting, with great presentation as well. I also thought the drinks were very good.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and thankfully there was no wait. The place has a nice ambiance- it's quite hip and spacious! It was also my first time trying Laotian food so I was excited. 

I ordered the khaw kai. It reminded me of pad see ew. The dish was pretty good, but I personally did not think it was spectacular or worth the price. I think I can find comparable food for a lower price.
author: Aimee Z.

description:
Came back last night to try this place again and it was SIGNIFICANTLY better. They've updated their menu since my last visit, and improved their service by miles. Glad I came back for a second go!

-Thai tea: very authentic! enjoyed the crushed ice they use!
-Lao sausage: spicy, but really delicious. It was pan fried so the skin was very crispy, loved it!
-Tom Yum Kung (medium spicy): thought it could've been spicier for medium, but next time I'll probably just order the hot. It was sour, which I liked and had lots of mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and prawns in the soup, which is different combo than the normal but in a way I liked! Wish they'd take out all the stuff they use to flavor the soup that isn't edible though b/c having to pick those out distracted me a bit from enjoying the soup
- Khaw Kai Noodles: tastes exactly like Pad See Ew; very flavorful and I loved pairing it with their homemade Sriracha sauce, which actually tastes a bit sweeter than the normal Sriracha you get in stores!
-Garlic pepper pork: Again, very flavorful and a large portion of pork. Comes with an over easy egg and a good amount of rice. The rice was cooked perfectly, which I appreciated!
-Cha-yen: Thai tea shaved snow with a scoop of thai tea ice cream and Laotian toppings (aka grass jelly, lychee, jackfruit, rambutan). As an avid exotic fruit eater, my bf enjoyed the different fruits, and I enjoyed the shaved snow...great way to end the meal!

The service was a lot better than last time - food came out a ton quicker and servers were much more friendly and inviting. The place is a bit pricy IMO (which is why -1 star) when you could go elsewhere for similarly authentic food, but there's definitely unique elements to Lao Table that take it to that price level...Would highly recommend for business lunch/dinners, big groups (saw a lot last night), and for a nice meal with your SO. Will be coming back for sure!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Best Laotian food experience. Being a Vegetarian always look for places where we can find better vegetarian options. This place has plenty of items to pick and each item at its best. They take care of a big group as well as a big order with at most professional manner. Their services are best too with time to time check as well as providing items properly.

Order Below Veg dish beside a bunch of Non Veg items in a group of 15 people.
Vegetarian Crispy Rolls
Fresh Spring Rolls
Tum Marg Hoong Papaya Salad
Red Curry Vegetarian
Spicy Eggplant
Lao Fried Rice Vegetarian

One of the good restaurants in SOMA.
author: Prerak T.

description:
Excellent. I agree with a previous reviewer: Lao Table is an upgrade from Osha Thai. 

I came here on a Saturday night with a group of three.

We ordered:
1. Lao sausage: Good. But I might opt to try the calamari appetizer next time instead.
2. ***Kobe beef: Well worth the price. I'm always hesitant to order steak because it's so easy to cook at home, but I'm glad I took the waiter's recommendation. Will definitely order this again.
3. Lao Fried Rice. Delicious. Warning: a little spicy. I would order this dish again, too.
4. Pho duck. Noodles were decent. I would opt to try the garlic pepper pork next time.

Bonus points for expanding napkins. All in all, I will definitely return to Lao Table
author: Bryan L.

description: Food was very tasty (the steak was perfectly cooked) and the service is on point. Servers are very attentive. Ambiance is great. Would definitely recommend and will be coming back.
author: Cathy A.

description: I LOVE this place. Came here for dinner for the first time earlier this week and shared the hot pot. It was a bit loud but still bearable. I would say great for groups. Everything was fairly priced, especially for the portions.... their Thai tea is out of this world! And I love how they serve it. The hot pot was also great, my boyfriend felt like it was the best soup he's ever had. It definitely had a lot of variety and looked and tasted very fresh. The broth is light and tangy. I was stuffed. I recommend making reservations if you come between 6-8. Great service, I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Christine T.

description: The Steak was really great probably one of my new favorites, and also the pork belly was very excellent it literally melts in your mouth, and the staff was great also.
author: Arvin N.

description: I am satisfied with this restaurant. Ordered the OM chicken, it is overly spicy but actually tasty. The dining environment is nice and bartenders are nice as well. Also tried the oysters, the quality was awful, could not taste the oyster flavor, maybe it had to do with the freshness and the type of the oyster! I gave a four stars because consider the location, the restaurant put serious effort on the food and the food are authentic which brought me back to Southeast Asia.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: We came in on a Monday for lunch and the place was packed. The food was full of flavor and the place has great ambiance.
author: Ngoc H.

description:
Amazing foods and great service
Fascinating severs. I've been to many Thai places, but this is awesome. This place is very nice and clean. Also, if you are looking for Birthday party, this is the place. Every dish I ordered has fantastic taste. One more thing, I feel like I am home again. ( I'm Thai)
author: Boo J.

description: I ordered mixed vegetables with jasmine rice and coconut water, it tasted well. Service was good, and food arrived in time. Food presentation was also really good. Taking 1 star away because they didn't have many vegetarian options.
author: Maulik S.

description:
This is my first time here at the Lao Table. We came as a group of six. The first thing we noticed is unique decorations, absolutely love it, even the restroom is so beautiful and clean. 

We started off with a dozen of oysters ($1 each for happy hours between 5-7 pm). Then we ordered a bowl of Tom Zaab Lao, Lao-style papaya salad, BBQ chicken, Larb duck (duck salad), Suae Hong Hai (Kobe beef salad), fried chicken and beef jerky. We must say that the food is excellent, the plate presentation is gorgeous and the price is so reasonable.

The service here is very exceptional. The staffs are so friendly and very helpful when we asked for recommendations and the owner even came to greet us. We really recommend this place to everyone.
author: Yuko K.

description: Super delicious and authentic Laos food. Excelent staff and service all night. Probably the cleanest restroom in all of san Francisco.  Came for happy hour. I recommend the beef jerky and laos sausage, also the calamari comes with a very tasty spicy tamarind sauce.
author: James P.

description:
Omg ! Very delicious I was very tired!
I was hungry, the service fantastic the manager gave me option because I am vegan and the result a delicious  lunch with a happy ending of a dessert that I returned the energy to back to my office very happy!! Thanks
author: Cici S.

description:
I had lunch here recently, and found it to be good overall.  First off, I made reservations on Yelp (which was very easy), so our table was waiting.  The ambiance was conducive to conversation (i.e., not too loud), and overall the space felt clean and comfortable.  The food was quite good (I had a vegetarian wok meal).

My only complaint is that the service was slow.  It took a while for our server to take our order, then deliver our Diet Cokes, then bring lunch.  Since it was a work day, it caused us to rush eating.  The restaurant was quite busy, so I assume that is why things were slow.

Overall, I liked my meal.  I plan to go back.
author: Brian O.

description:
Authentic Laotian & Thai cuisine
Beautiful presentation, comfortable and thoughtfully-designed dining space
GM Kitty is the most gracious host, I always feel welcomed and taken care of here.
This is a perfect place for gathering with friends, families and business engagements.
author: Victoria Y.

description: I love this place so much. I always order Spicy Steak Lao. This is my favorite dish so far. I came here every Monday Night on my day off. Love the food and service for sure. I would love to come more often if I could.
author: Tanapon S.

description:
Food presentation is best I have seen so far. Taste is like Thai food and awesome. Quantity they serve in the plate is sufficient for two good meals.
Waiters are great in service and food was served in time.
Definitely recommend this place.
author: Vishnu M.

description: The chicken pho was tasty, could have been a little more salty and fatty.  Good for larger groups, not too noisy, long tables and quick service.
author: Simon S.

description: Found out this former Osha Thai  is a new restaurant, and was tickled to see their offerings! Pork neck salad! Absolutely the best dish, and my favorite piece of pork, ok, it does rival belly. Their seafood noodle hot pot was crazy good, and I love how you eat with your eyes because every dish comes out looking like a piece of art. The chicken satays are super tender and flavorful and I actually liked the dipping sauce! Giving 4 stars because it takes a while to get their attention after all the food is served, otherwise I really enjoyed this place!
author: Darlene B.

description: Love happy hours in this precious restaurant. Oyster just only 1$ and its taste so good so sweet. Love the lovely atmosphere in the house. Even though this is my first time oyster in San Francisco, it makes me wanna comeback again and again.
author: Wattanawiboonkit D.

description: This place is definitely a great Thai-Laotian restaurant/bar. The taste of food is awesome! The price here is a little bit above the average of Thai restaurants but the quality is higher as well. A lot of professionals come here after work and the place is almost packed. The service here is good as well. Especially Tanna who is a great bartender. She is nice and sweet. When I sat at the bar, she patiently explained the ingredients of the cocktails and what's special for each of them when she was making the drinks.
author: Elisa Y.

description: Best Thi ever i recommend the sizzling scallops and for dessert i recommend the mango dessert
author: Kahalawai L.

description:
VERY slow service and crazy expensive entrees! $20 for a lunch entree is absolutely insane!  We had a business lunch here and it took a very long time for our server to help us from the moment we sat down. We were concerned at first but decided to stick it out. Unfortunately, we were not expecting a lunch to take 2 hours to be served. We ended up asking for it to go and ate our entrees back at our office.

The food tasted good which is why they get the additional star, but we will never return again. I miss Osha!
author: Ladan G.

description:
I tried Lao Table with my cousin last Saturday night. Great food, but overpriced. It felt more Thai than Laotian. After reading about it after my meal, I realized it is opened by Osha Thai. It was then that everything made sense. Dinner came out to $90 including 15% tip for both of us. We had 1 appetizer, 1 entree each that included jasmine rice (I added $2 for brown rice), and shared a mark mango shaved ice with sticky rice dessert ($13). My favorite part of the meal was the dessert. Both the entrees were decent in terms of portion, but nothing over the top wow. I felt the same way about the appetizer. We probably would have saved $30 if we went to Osha Thai for similar food and ambiance. Since April was the owner's birthday, the restaurant was giving a "surprise" gift to anyone who celebrated their birthday with the restaurant. The owner had every worker wear a funny t shirt with the caption "Kings are born in April", a reference to the owner being born in April.

Pros:
+Easy to get a reservation on open table. Even for a Saturday night, they had peak time availability. 
+Ample space. Great ambiance. Comfortable seats.
+Great service. Water was always filled.
+Takes credit card.
+Decent selection on menu covering vegetarians, pescatarians, and carnivores.
+Very accessible to public transit. Closest to Montgomery Station.
+Nice plating.

Cons:
-Difficult to find parking.
-Overpriced. I think fair value would be $60 for a meal of 2 at this place.
-Nothing too amazing. It wasn't terrible, just not "wow".
-Can be a bit noisy. There were kids running around and sugar high from the mango dessert next to us.
author: Tina C.

description:
Any meal at Lao Table is truly a feast for the senses! Even after multiple dinners here, I am still discovering new dishes to love! Each dish is a finely tuned composition of novel flavors and textures that also celebrates quality ingredients. 

- Koi Tuna: A fresh take on tuna tartare with spicy kick

- Confit duck wings: Perfectly crispy and delicious

- Tom Zaab Lao: A braised pork based soup with just the right note of tanginess, a much needed antidote to this winter weather

- Crispy Sticky Rice Salad: My new comfort food. Tender and crisped grains of rice intermingled with bits of spicy Lao sausage, accompanied by a bouquet of vibrant, fresh basil, dill and lettuces. A dish best enjoyed with your hands :)

-Suae Hong Hai: The Crying Tiger Steak. Pink. Perfect. Absolutely tender.

The space is just as beautiful and visual as the food. From the impressive rows of bells suspended from the ceiling above the bar, to the gorgeous hued lanterns and stunning flower arrangements, there is just as much for your eyes to enjoy. 

Lastly, no dining experience could ever be complete without the presence of friendly, attentive and gracious staff. Overall, an experience not to be missed!
author: Joie K.

description: One of my favorite place to eat while I was in the city for a few days! The waitress where nice and accommodating. It's a bit pricey but worth it. The whole experience was worth it. Food was delicious , I had the spicy steak with sticky rice. So if you're ever around union square downtown area try this place out it's worth it!!
author: Hiep B.

description:
My relatives with children were in town for a visit. They were staying at hotel close to this restaurant. We put in reservations for a Monday night and were seated promptly.

First observation is that perhaps this is not a place to take children to. Not that they were giving off vibe of being not child-friendly. Quite the opposite, everyone was super accommodating and super nice. But there is a nice bar, with happy hours on weekdays. So I would say this is most definitely for adults to go to after work in the Financial District/SOMA. Just happens to be very child-friendly as well, if your children are 6+ like ours ;)

As for the restaurant itself... well we all forgot about our worry of child-friendly places to dine at. The food here is amazing! First time trying Laotian food and it reminded us of Thai and Vietnamese food. Which makes sense since they are all in the same neighborhood.

The tuna tartare was delicious. Chicken satay and fried spring rolls too mmm. The kids both got the Pho Beef with all the veggies removed haha. I got the Pho Beef too and man, I'd have to say the best one I've had. The beef just melted in your mouth, so tender. Also shared the Tom Yum soup.. yaaasss soooo good!! We all enjoyed the taste of everything. You can tell everything was top quality. Of course you pay for that quality! The Pho Beef was $17. Tom Yum bowl was $25 I think. So it is pricey but totally worth it I think. 

Great job Osha Thai! We will definitely be back to enjoy adult time next time ;)
author: Vol T.

description:
I took my team here for lunch.  The restaurant is really modern and clean.  We had great servers and the menu were pretty solid.  All the dishes came out were meeting or exceeding our expectations.  Definitely don't miss out the pork belly and the crispy rice salad.  Refrain yourself from ordering the familiar dishes that you find in other Thai restaurants.  

BTW - this used to be the OSHA Thai restaurant- they just converted over ..
author: Tom V.

description: Awesome hospitality and overall service. The food was a bit pricey but was enjoyable and good tasting. Portions were big as well.
author: Thinh N.

description: Went their for a lunch meeting. Nice food and nice place. I tried LAO fried chicken and it was delicious. A little expensive for tai but it is a nice place to dine for special occasions
author: Yasaman D.

description: For the quality and price that you're paying Lao table is as good as it get in downtown SF for Laotian food. We're order Gai yang is very amazing!!!
author: Amgirl Z.

description: Tried this for the $6 oyster deal, only to realize we are not very fond of oysters. It was still a very classy place with good beer and customer service.
author: Nishi S.

description:
Food is amazing and presentation is on point!  Started with grilled octopus that's oddly Delish in a spicy healthy way (heft portion). Salmon dish was perfect for my kid (all dishes are super big portions FYI). Kobe beef grill was stupid good--like butter with that sauce. The "Alaskan crab" noodle dish was so good (needs more crab--tons of veggies if you wanna justify it and feel healthy haha). Oh, don't forget to get the Spicy Eggplant with chicken (OMG--very Thai inspired and bomb!)
Chocolate soufflé with Thai tea ice cream was the perfect way to end the evening. Good housey lounge music, clean bathrooms, servers come around every few minutes to check . Overall 10/10
author: Cali H.

description: Probably the best authentic Thai-Laotian food in the Bay! I had gai yaang (grilled chicken with papaya salad), miang pla (vegetable wraps), zeen ping (lemongrass marinated beef), and mark mango (mango sticky rice with shaved ice). Everything was tasty and fresh. The service was also phenomenal and the waiters are really nice. I can't wait to come back!!
author: Chris C.

description:
Pricey, but good food.

I think they should rewrite the description for relishes, as my friends were hesitant to order as they thought it was more akin to American small relishes than say chutney. If you don't know Lao food it's a littler harder to imagine what it looks like.

The price point is high, I understand for it location and it is SF but this makes it a bit harder sell to get people try as a casual option. 

Very upscale versions of Lao dishes. Loved the desserts the most.
author: Tara P.

description: This place is incredible, the food is mouth watering awesome and the staff is amazing. This place is an absolute must GO !!!!!
author: Dana T.

description:
The food was very average. 
We ordered chicken satay (way too salty ), spring rolls (OK OK ), om chicken curry ( bland, we left the entire curry), red curry chicken ( better than everything else ). I have had so much better Thai food in sf.
Will not return.
author: Shaifali A.

description: I had dinner with a friend who has particular taste on food. The friendly waitress and delicate setup of food score，and we both agree this makes the restaurant a good place to treat people decently. However, the taste is specially designed in American style~ too sweet~in every dish. The wrappers of spring roll are thick while the sauce is great. The noodles are plain and we shall not suggest you order them. Anyway, you will be disappointed if you are looking forward to real good taste in Vietnamese cuisine.
author: Tianlu W.

description: Really good food. Not too spicy but incredibly tasty. They have a good selection or cocktails as well.
author: Gaurav K.

description: The food here is so good and there are so many options for vegetarians! Order the fried spring rolls - they're amazing. I also ordered the pineapple fried rice and my husband ordered the spicy eggplant. The portions are huge, so come hungry. The ambiance is great, and service is good. Will definitely come back.
author: Sue V.

description:
Came here with some friends after work. I was super excited to see their $1 Oyster during HH! We get seated at a table, and was told you can only get oysters at the bar, not in the dining area... LIKE WTF... It's not like the 2 areas are disjointed. What difference does it make for me to sit a few feet away? I thought this was the dumbest thing I ever heard of in a restaurant. So we ordered a few things and some entrees, and after I literally walked 6 steps and ordered the $1 oysters. 

Despite the dumbest rule ever, the oysters were huge and their Laotian/ Thai spicy sauce with it was a great combo!

Appetizers like their Spring rolls are very good. The entrees.... Not so much. Thought my Chicken Basil dish was very bland. The chicken was very tough and chewy and lacked flavor/ seasoning. Wasn't impressed when I tried my friends' dishes as well. 

Overall, definitely coming back for the oysters. The actual food, probably not worth it. Also thought the price was pretty high for their type of cuisine where the food wasn't spectacular or memorable.
author: Charles L.

description:
Food: Very good! I ordered the pork belly and it was delicious. The sausage appetizer was also very good (but be warned, it is spicy).

Service: The service was good.

Cost: The dishes were a bit pricy in relation to the portion size.

Ambience: Casual, but also a bit upscale. Very clean. Great for taking visiting friends out to dinner if you need to meet them after work.
author: Nick E.

description:
I dropped in for lunch and there was very busy. I order the kra pow lamb. It is so good. The service is amazing. I will bring my girlfriend next time for sure. 
I love to try more thing but the portion is so big.
author: Pitchaporn Y.

description:
Decided to take a visit in the bay and decided to see if there was any Lao food near by . Surprisingly this one pop up on my yelp  . Read some reviews , some good some bad . Decided to come anyways because I am Laotian and was craving Lao food and wanted to see what they had in store . Knowing deep down I might not be happy with the food because I don't know if it will taste authentic or not ! 

Inside is very nice , tables are close to each other like some had said on the reviews . It was just me and my Bf . He ordered the beef larb , Thai tea and sticky rice . So I took a taste of it , beef larb was good but not good enough for the price . It was just a basic larb, flavor was there but not really . To me it was kind of dried . I had better . I mean most of the stuff here is pricey, so if you're not trying to pay extra money I'll say just go to a Thai restaurant that do serve this that is a little less money out of your pocket . Thai tea was ok , we had to ask for sugar kus it wasn't sweet enough . Sticky rice was ok, I don't think it was that fresh because around the sticky rice it was getting hard . Like you just threw the sticky rice in the microwave to warm it up . & if you don't eat it fast enough it'll get hard . So I was disappointed . 

I ordered the Lao crispy rice salad I believe that's what it's called . So I'm thinking Naam khao . Grew up eating this dish at Laotian parties and stuff . So I'm like ok I'll give this a try . My dish came out , you can tell rice was crispy and all that . I ordered mines Spicy but I don't know if they add pepper flakes in this or they just gave me extra fried peppers . I was surprise their fried peppers were spicy . Anyways I had my first bite , it had a strong kick to it . Like a strong fish sauce kick . I'm like woo. The more you eat the more you don't taste it anymore . To be honest this dish was plain to me . I'm surprise it didn't have any lime or lemon on this dish kus this dish should have that little sour kick to it . But it didn't , so I asked for some . If you order this dish I suggest you to ask for some lime . It'll make it taste way better than before ! 

Next time I visit the bay I don't think I'll be here again .
author: Cindy A.

description:
Awesome Snake River Farm Kobe beef!! Very juicy, don't need the dipping sauce! Highly recommend!
Grilled calamari - very nice and chewy.
Mok Seabass - looks messy, too much herbs that takes away the flavor of the fish. Not appetizing!
Koi tuna - flavor not bad except way too spicy!!

Overall the food is not bad! Very nice presentation! Worth a try! Heard they have durian shave ice too! It's seasonal so better try before it's gone!!
author: Raymond L.

description: One-star for the terrible service experienced the last few times I dined here! I decided to have my birthday dinner at Lao Table, just with my mother and father. Right off the bat, we were seated near the bar area and the lady-bartender was quite unpleasant from the get-go, seeming to not even want to be there or be of service. By the end of the meal (which was decent), they hadn't even asked if we wanted dessert!! Tony (server mentioned in last review) wasn't our main server but apologized for our actual server(s) not checking on us by the end of our meal. We left a little bummed but still wanting to give this place another chance. We then returned for my mother's birthday and experienced even worse service than before!! Still nobody asked if we wanted dessert, nobody checked on us throughout our meal, and worst of all, the bartender-lady took away our plates and dishes before we were finished - without asking !!! So rude! We had to tell her "I'm sorry, we're not done yet..." to which there was no apology, just the plate set back down and her walking away without a word. I'm not usually very picky and am very reasonable, but this was just an awful way to treat PAYING customers... It just seems like the bar area in particular is not given the proper attention and service it deserves. We will surely not be returning after experiences like this.
author: Jenn V.

description:
Ate here last night for my boyfriends birthday. We had initially planned on eating somewhere else but the wait was too long. We walked in off the street here and we're not disappointed. Quite the opposite. This place is so good. 

We ordered the spring rolls, which were the best I've ever had. And I eat A LOT of spring rolls. My chicken basil bowl was scrumptious! Will be coming back here. Oh yeah, and we got the Mark Mango for dessert!
author: Malaya I.

description: Everything was really delisious!! Interia was so cute and atmosphere was cusual and comfy. If you wanna real Thai food, I really recomend this restaurant!
author: Mari T.

description: I was very pleased with the food here. I have been to Lao and enjoyed the food their very much. This was a gourmet version of that experience. The flavors were perfect and the quality of the ingredients was excellent. I will certainly be returning here.
author: Rich C.

description: The food was really good. They have several authentic dishes that many Thai restaurants in Bay Area don't have. This is my second time here and I'll definitely come back.
author: Nattarika W.

description:
We really liked this place. The food was delicious and the people were very friendly. If you are in the are, I would def recommend this place. Also wonderful cocktails! 

Thanks for making me a happy Jew!
author: David F.

description:
Went here for my girlfriend's birthday with a group of ten. Half our table was 45 mins late, but they still took great care of us.

Cocktails were very creative and tasty. We ate family style and the food was great. Tried six dishes and each was delicious, so you really can't go wrong.
author: Mark M.

description:
Food is just so so. I ordered Gang Beef under curry section and it came like a beef tom you soup. Too bland, and the food is way overpriced. Had wayyy better Lao food elsewhere. 

Although food is mediocre at best, what brought the star from two to one is the service. I've been sitting for an hour and the drink is not even ready until I asked them two times, and arrived AFTER I finished the meal. Impressive. 

We came in as a huge party and people near my end ordered duck wings. And they delivered the food to the other end. That was pretty accurate. 

To be honest, the decor and ambience is pretty nice and they've got pretty rare scotch in their drink list, but that's all the good thing about this spot. If you came here just for food, this is probably the last place I'd recommend for Lao food.
author: Charles L.

description:
Great food.
Excellent service.
Beautiful decor.
Go for the mango sticky rice you won't regret it.
Side of sticky rice at 4.5$ Is on the expensive side but that was an awesome experience overall.
Strongly recommend
author: Tarek B.

description:
I would describe this spot as.. not terrible? The high ratings on Yelp for this place has me scratching my head a bit. To me this was not worth the trip, but perhaps others just order better. Go at your own risk!

We had the duck over rice, which came with a soup, the fried pork belly and the beef curry, and a f-lao's cocktail.  The cocktail was great and probably the highlight of the meal, but the food was pretty mediocre. 

Beef curry was a liquidy soup with tough beef but had good spicy flavors. The pork belly were fried, bite sized bits of pork and pretty tasty, but I guess it's tough to screw up deep fried meats. The duck over rice was the worst dish. The duck was over cooked, dry and chewy. The rest was just a soy based sauce over rice and half a hard boiled egg. The food is even less worthwhile when you consider the high prices. 

.. but at least the cocktail was good.
author: John S.

description: Sat at the bar, they were pretty busy on a Friday.  Service was ok, not friendly.  I had the vegetarian Lao fried rice and it was delicious, good level of spice and the spicy basil topped it off.  Also very nice space in a good location.
author: Shelley A.

description: The restaurant is private it makes me feel good, I really like this place. The food was delicious and very fresh. I recommend dessert because it had a lot of fruit and good qualiThe staff is very friendly. I will come back this restaurant.
author: Tawan C.

description: Our meal here was bow down worthy! I literally was smiling like a fool the entire dinner! The decor is so beautiful and chic and the food and drinks were amazing! We got the lao sausage for starters and it was delicious and authentic just the way I've had is at lao temple and from my friends mom! Then continued onto the mok sea bass and spicy steak which again were so flavorful and authentic! If I lived in the bay area, this would be one of my regular go to restaurants!
author: Nhu P.

description:
My friend came here for her birthday dinner on a Saturday night. There was a whole fiasco with the reservation because despite her having made many calls to the restaurant, they said they don't see her name anywhere once she arrived. The party had to wait for 30 minutes but I wasn't there for any part of it! haha this part is irrelevant to my review

I'm reviewing this restaurant based on the service and food. Service wise was great, waiter was attentive and our water glasses remained full for the most part. He was also pretty diligent in getting seconds for our drinks, and always with a smile on his face.

Now food. It was all presented BEAUTIFULLY, and the porcelain dining sets were exquisite. Flavor is not too bad, but I can easily find replicas of the same dishes in a hold in a wall for a significantly lower price. Of course, I'm paying for the ambiance and service. Portion was CRAZY small, and thank goodness most people in the party has a small appetite (hehe more for me!) We ordered curry chicken, veggie spring rolls, eggplant, beef lettuce rice, pad mee (which was the best) and pad moo pa. 

Would be interested to come back to try out more menu items, but would definitely need to see how my wallet is doing LOL
author: Ivy W.

description: I took my friend to try Lao food at Lao Table for the first time. She loved it!!!! We ordered the Bamboo Salad and Numtok Kurobuta. They both were tasty especially the Numtok Kurobuta. Then we ended our meal with Mark Mango, love it!!!!!!! The service was good, the restroom was clean and the location was convenient. I will definitely come back!!!!
author: Pim N.

description:
Format: went here for an 8-person work lunch on a Wednesday. 

Service: served very promptly. only issue was the fact that we chose to eat family style and there were no serving utensils with the dishes. 

Food: everyone loved the food. favorites were the chicken curry and pan-fried noodles and chicken entree. we were not fans of the beef lettuce wraps. 

Ambiance: lovely interior design/decor. very modern with a lot of personality and high end furnishings.

Price: price is pretty high if you are not dining via corporate card. Dishes range from $12 - $30.
author: Kylee L.

description: The soup was really nice and filing. Its a bit pricey for the quantity though. But really good taste overall. The ambience is great too, especially at night
author: Ayushman J.

description:
The food is decent. Nothing out of this world. The mango sticky rice dessert item comes with 2 desserts -a very small plate with mango and sticky rice and another bowl with a tower of shaved ice on which you pour mango juice.
I didn't care for the ice dessert at all. Might as well drink mango juice with ice.
I love mango sticky rice in general but the serving was very little. So not worth the price.

Overall, decent food and overpriced! You can get the same kind of food elsewhere for a lot less. 
Here you are paying for the ambiance not food.
author: BlueStar V.

description: Idea environment for dating, the drink tastes good, the noodle and pork cooked well, would recommend this place.
author: Tong Z.

description: Amazing!!! Ambience, food, service was all top notch! Came here on a Wednesday night with a reservation for 10.  It wasn't too busy and we got seated right away. Every single dish that we ordered did not disappoint! I did not get to try the cool looking fruit bowl, but a friend that went with us said she has tried it before it and it wasn't  worth the price so we opt out of it. Overall, I will definitely be returning to eat everything!
author: Tina H.

description:
Made a reservation for 7:30 and the hostess escorted me to a table right away. Right off the bat, I just loved the lively atmosphere and it looked like everyone was enjoying their dinners.

So we ordered the koi tuna,the spicy eggplant (wok), and the tom en keow (soup). I thought the koi tuna was just okay- it was a small portion appetizer that came with crouton chips and lettuce. Good, but was not eagerly digging up for more. The spicy eggplant was great- the tofu, eggplant, and sauce were perfectly cooked and had just the right amount of spice. The tom en keow was my favorite part. It had bits of tender beef short ribs and pineapple pieces. The soup was just so tangy, creamy and delicious, and it tasted so right with a side of rice.

It's a bit on the pricier side, but I'd really love to go back to try out the rest of the menu!
author: Sarah L.

description: Held up my birthday party here a couple weeks ago, it was really great choice end up here with spectacular foods and services. The staffs was also offering us a warm greeting and taking care of the party during the night. The part of the food is also amazing! We oredered 9 dishes,all foods came out really fast. All of dishes is very thorough. Plus the dessert, we got a fancy complimentary mango sticky rice and thai iced tea shaved ice which is really flavored. By the end of the night,im pretty sure that everyone happy with a full services in here. We love everything about this place.
author: Nina R.

description: Love it. This was a business lunch meeting and Lao Table does an awesome job! Always..
author: M M.

description: Service was extremely slow. They were nice, but meals/drinks in between felt like it took 45-1hr to get to us. We got the fancy Pineapple cup drink for $16. Tasted very watered down. Would not recommend. Even the thai iced tea in a small round cup was $7 and it wasn't even the best we've had. I took off 2 stars for those purposes however the food was actually very tasty. We started off with garlic chicken wings, juicy, decent garlic flavor. Lao fried rice and stir lao pad thai was tasty as well but just tasted like regular pad thai  The crying Tiger steak, didnt have a very pleasing display but it was actually pretty Fantastic. Our Favorite dish.. We ended with the mango sticky rice and icy dessert. I would skip this as well. Its large and meant to share but a few things we didn't like was that it was basically just a fluff of ice with artificial mango flavoring, sticky rice seemed very hard.. I would return to reorder some of the dishes I mentioned like the steak and fried rice, and try other things but I wouldn't reorder the other items.
author: Tina C.

description: I came in on Thursday around 7:15.   this was 6th time back here ... i'm a regular at osha...this time i wanted a little bit fancier so i gave   this place a try again... hostess told me she cant seat me because I was only one person ..Wow then she told me to come back tomorrow...so this how u treat you local costumers... i was very upset and walked off... one of the severs remembered me from last time ran out apologized to me and offered to get a table for me he was a great server ..unfortunately the host ruined it for me  Don't  worry I wont come back here so disappointed... don't come here if u only one person  !!!
author: David L.

description: Food was pretty good, but not 20 dollars a dish good. Laotian food is very similar to Thai food. You're basically paying for the atmosphere.
author: Irene Y.

description: Papaya salad is great. Try the Tamarind beef.  Service is great. If you plan to bring your loved one, be advised that the space is fairly noisy for quiet conversation. Desserts looked great, but didn't try any. I want to come back to try the Pho Duck, and the German style crispy pork knuckle.
author: Ricardo M.

description:
The plaid wallpaper adds an unexpected touch of color to the ceiling. It's a nice setting for interesting asian food, but not in a dumpy little hole-in-the-wall.  Oh, with cocktails too.   

Service was well-intentioned, but slow and not well trained yet.  The food has interesting spices and ingredients (like a small round eggplant and something that looked like a branch of peppercorns), and generally quite well prepared.  I did not love the calamari, but that's because it was ONE giant calamari (grilled and cut up) and it's so hard to get that cooked just-right, between the unappetizing flabby texture when undercooked and nasty rubber-band texture when overcooked.  the grilled celery goes really nicely with it and there's great grill flavor and smokiness and a nice sauce.

what I did not like:  the menu should've been more informative about how Laotian cuisine is both similar to and different from Thai.  And how does Pho fit in?  I thought that was Vietnam? SO i'd like the menu to be a little more focused on Laos.  I'd also have a 'set plate' for lunch, that would be less expensive, and also served faster (for people who would want to grab a quick lunch there, rather than sitting & mingling, with cocktails).  I think the 'lunch set menu' now is intended for takeout?     

I saw another comment here that it's priced for people on an expense account and I don't disagree.  In fact, at one point while we were there, an older couple, casually dressed, came in for lunch, sat down, had a look at the menu for awhile, and then got up and left.  Might've been the $22 Pho but I can't be certain.   I don't usually pay much attention to the prices but I'm going to guess this menu pricing will be downright shocking to some out of town visitors.
author: Jaina S.

description: Normally I only really care about the quality of food at a restaurant, but Lao Table stands out for its unique decor and incredibly friendly staff. The food is a treat too: tasty, well plated, and with some pretty unique dishes. I'm not sure how authentic a Laotian cuisine experience this is, but Lao Table is a solid choice for a semi-fancy lunch or dinner.
author: Blake A.

description: Nice place, good food, good atmosphere and friendly staff. Good presentation of the food too. Portions are smaller than usual which is what it is supposed to be, quality over quantity.
author: Levent K.

description: I was a little underwhelmed with this restaurant. The restaurant looks really cool/the ambiance is great, but the flavors were a little lacking and the calamari was definitely a little chewy.
author: Christina L.

description:
Laotian food with some Thai and Vietnamese influence.  But quite authentic and delicious food.  Interior decor is excellent and modern.  There is just slight bit of SF hip vibe to it but that's ok given that it's in a popular city center.  I tasted many of the popular dishes and they came out nice with good presentation but they were just a bit on the bland side - nothing pungent or smelly but more clean and tidy kind of way, which isn't how I remember the "real thing" from South East Asia.  Overall, I'd say it's a good comprise between the real thing vs. Americanized sweet Thai stuff.  I'd go back. 

By the way, it's quite noisy in there.
author: Allen K.

description: Great happy hour deal. A nice bougie place to stop by after work. The drinks were strong, and the appetizers were good. The dessert here was especially incredible.
author: Nikita K.

description: We came here for an early dinner and had a lovely meal. The place was clean, stylish, and larger inside than expected. The staff were very delightful and pleasant. Ambiance was great. High ceilings. I think the acoustics ( read: ability to hear without yelling) would be good even when the place is full. The food was amazingly good. Banana blossom salad, oysters, curry, all very good. I'll be dining here again as soon as possible!
author: Bron L.

description:
Delicious! The raw tuna appetizer was fantastic, as was the Lao sausage. The fried eggplant wok was very nice, but I would ask for extra sauce next time. The papaya salad was a huge dish that came with shrimp and noodles and a sausage-adjacent item -- tasty, but more than we were looking for from the order. And the beef curry was just nothing special. We finished with the mango shaved ice and sticky rice dessert, which was excellent!!! The mai tai is, obviously, super sweet. The table 75 cocktail is nice and smooth, and the Grenache Syrah by the glass was pretty good! 

Service was great, we were seated immediately upon arrival at our reservation time, never felt rushed during the meal, but they did start to close the restaurant while we were still eating  dessert at 10 pm, which wasn't the most hospitable. Overall, great, would go back!
author: Kelsey G.

description:
A little pricey but the food is so good.

Thai ice cream with chocolate souffle for birthdays is great.
author: Dorothy Y.

description: I highlyrecommend the mango shaved ice and the Thai tea ice cream+lava cake. It is soooo good!!! Also the curry shrimp is delicious!Will come back soon
author: Iris S.

description: The desert here is SO GOOD!!! Especially get the mango shaved ice with condescended milk. Sooooooo good
author: Martha S.

description: The decor is cute, music is cool and the staff are attentive but the food was not impressive. We started with a dozen oysters and the calamari then moved on to the duck lettuce wraps. The oysters were fresh and the dipping sauce was spicy but the calamari was over fried, tough and chewy. The duck was ground meat that tasted like ground turkey. Was hoping for something of higher caliber like sliced duck breast. We had a couple rounds of the Get Lao'd, one of their signature cocktails, but it was mostly ice and a stuffed toy elephant. For our entrees we had the sea bass and spicy eggplant with prawns added. Again, surprisingly underwhelming given these high reviews. The sea bass was over steamed and dry. We did not finish it. The eggplant and prawn dish was average and only had 4 small sized prawns. For dessert we chose the mango sticky rice and chocolate soufflé. We should have left without dessert.
author: Rob R.

description: I'm glad to finally got the chance to try this place. Everything was great! Excellent service, tasty food and big portion and of course original cocktails. I really like the ambience of the place. I would highly recommend Lao Table to anyone ;)
author: Ornella G.

description: Don't come here if you're vegetarian. Food was very bland and overpriced for what you get.
author: Pavan K.

description:
One of the hip and new spots on 2nd street. Anytime I see excessively fancy Thai fare, I'm wary that it may lack in flavor. Not here! The bamboo shoot salad is delightfully presented, spicy, tangy, and light. Fried pork belly was also a good balance for the starter. I wish I remembered the name of the noodles I had, but the menu is not visible on Yelp yet.

The internal ambiance is very chic, and loud. Seems like a good place to bring a group or grab a drink.
author: Irina P.

description:
Again, I don't normally give five stars, but was close with Lao Table.

A medium sized group for later mid-week dinner:
*Amazing service.
*Spot on decore.
*Every dish we had was tops on flavor, display, presentation and satisfaction.
*Ah, the KUROBUTA PORK BELLY
Five Spice Kurobuta Pork Layer + Pickle Cabbage W/ Jasmine Rice
Damnnnnnn. . .great!
*The place was elegant with a nice floral undertone to it. Really. 
*The KOI TUNA
Spicy Tuna Tartare "Koi" + Napa Farmer Market Endive + Vegetable Chips & Toasted Baguette
was amazing. Again, great presentaion and the use of the grilled rice powder in with the tuna gave it a good texture.
*The Tom En Keow soup was also the best. The beef short ribs were flavor filled/melt in your mouth.
*Finishing off the main with the pineapple fried rice as a base was perfect.
*The tea service is the best. Try the blue butterfly tea. Great flavor.
*Do finish with the CHA-YEN
"Cha-Yen" Thai Iced Tea Shaved-ice with LAOTIAN Topping.

Just Go!
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
It blows my mind how slow the service is here. For those who are only interested in how good the food was - tldr; it was decent but definitely not worth the wait. 

I wouldn't say the food at Lao Table is unique or is anything better or different from what it used to be (Osha Thai). I'm definitely no expert in Thai/Laotian food, but I can certainly say I've had better tasting tom yum soup. 

Now, back to my original point - came here with a party of 14. Yes, a large party, but we had a reservation, and it's nothing out of the norm for financial district. All I ordered was a cup of tom yum soup, and a sticky rice salad. Of every single person at the table, i was the last person to get my food, by a loooong shot. How is a cup of soup and salad the slowest dish to come out??? I was definitely beyond hangry at that point. The rest of the table's food also came out in slow motion; appetizers came after the main course was served -___-

Would not recommend coming here if you're in a rush. Even if you're not in a rush, there is much better food around the area.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Stopped here with a last minute reservation just before the place filled up.  It was packed for a reason - great food and prompt service without being rushed.

We loved the spring rolls and chicken satay.

Entrees did not disappoint - noodle bowl and garlic pepper pork.

Free entertainment included - the group of young people next to us who just couldn't believe they weren't making more money in their careers - fresh out of college and OMG to everything.

Great place to come back to on another trip to SF.
author: Nick B.

description: We wanted to have some great food after a hard day at work and this fit the bill perfectly. We dont have many great Thai restaurants back home, so this choice was a no-brained.  The restaurant was packed but we were able to get in without reservation and got excellent service. We tried several different dishes and they were all excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant
author: Igor V.

description:
This is one of the best Thai restaurants in San Francisco.
If you need to visit a Thai restaurant in San Francisco, I recommend this place.
author: Josh J.

description: went here last month with a group of co-workers.  convenient location to offices.   the place was really packed but our reservation was earlier so we were seated right away.  a lot of really good selections.  i got the chilean sea bass and a thai iced tea.  entree its served in a leaf and mixed with herbs and natural tasting flavors.  tasted like lemongrass with a little spice.  i liked it a lot.  some others in the group got the steak and the pork belly.  everyone said their food was good.  dessert was iced cream in a coconut.  price is a little higher, but okay for every now and then.  next time i want to try the fried rice with chicken wings.
author: Richard M.

description: Really loved my Khaw Kai Noodles! I think the best Thai food I've had. My husband had the Red Curry which was delicious as well. Unfortunately a bit of a mess up with delivery at first, but the food certainly made up for it. Will definitely have it again the next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Liesl G.

description: The ambience is too loud and the server will recommend the most expensive instead of what is good. Great for parties but not for a date
author: Jason W.

description: Absolutely exceeded expectations. Beautiful and delicious food in an upscale atmosphere. Friendly attentive staff. Prices seemed very fair for San Francisco considering what we've paid for less than stellar food from a few other places. The only downside was my fiancé wanted pad Thai and they didn't have it. Just because of the sheer number of great restaurants in San Francisco we won't likely visit it again this trip, I would highly recommend it to anybody that wants something different from the every day meal.
author: David L.

description: This is pretty new and used to be Osha Thai before I believe. It is beautifully done and has a very nice decor. Since it was packed, we ate at the bar which was actually nice since it was a little quieter. I got the pad see noodles and the crispy roll which were good. The chocolate soufflé with thai ice tea ice cream was a nice finish to the meal. It is slightly on the expensive side but If you are interested in trying Laotian food, you should stop by.
author: Sunil R.

description:
First off, if you are going to charge this much money (should be $$$$) then I'd expect way better service.   And they also got our order wrong and sent us one wrong appetizer.  Considering Laotian food is extremely cheap normally this felt like even more of a gouge.

The food was fine (not exceptional) but this rating is based on the service & quality I'd expect for the price.   For the price this is definitely 2 star at most.  Very slow service (waitstaff was more concerned with napkin placement on the sea of empty tables rather than focusing on customers... Full staff and only like 3 tables occupied and everyone paying top dollar to be neglected.)

OSHA is mediocre Thai food that is overpriced and this just takes that theme to the next level.
author: Jesse J.

description: Great food, great atmosphere. Got take out lunch. It was ready right on time and very yummy. Ordered Chicken Satay. Chicken was really, really tender. Probably the best I've ever had.
