I got sticky rice, poured the peanut sauce over it and cut up the chicken. Perfect meal. Got the basil chicken for a friend. He loved it. I thought it was good but perhaps a tad dry. I'll definitely be back.
author: Shelly S.

description: Great food. Slow service. The waiter messed up our order. Even though they switched our messed up order, our appetizer came after our meal. But liked the ambience in general
author: Sudin S.

description: Stopped here for dinner after work today with a coworker. The spicy eggplant and pad pha beef were both very tasty, and the staff was friendly. A large part of the menu is dishes that are protein + starch, with fewer vegetable items, though. Decent drink selection as well. Overall, we enjoyed the food and atmosphere.
author: Brian C.

description: It was very easy to make a dinner reservation for two on a Wednesday night. I thought the service was good, and the amount of food we were served was great! The price justifies for how much food you get. We got the chicken ginger & rice entree and the prawn noodle entree and I really liked both. The atmosphere is pretty nice, you're actually able to hear the person across from you talking.
author: Joyce L.

description: Delicious Laotian/Thai place conveniently located next to work. Love love love the pork belly appetizer-it's seriously fried pork crack! The ambiance is lovely, and the cocktails are strong. My only caveats are it's on the pricey side tHough par for the neighborhood. And it can get a little loud so you may have to tell to hear your date.
author: Jazmine C.

description: I have been to to this restaurant for my reunion dinner. The menu is complicated menu but my waiter help me to order my dinner. I love the ambiance of the front bar, the lighting and sound is perfect. I'll definitely be back when I need convenient place near my house for fancy drink and fancy Laotiaon food. I'll come back again soon
author: Tara T.

description: Firt time here and I was impressed with how flavorful each dish were and how they came together. Strongly suggest Tuesday special Green Curry Chicken. Must try!!!
author: Artist P.

description: This place just makes you feel good it makes you feel like you've mad it in the world of Lao and awesome decor. The staff is very friendly. Getting to the restaurant itself is a journey.
author: Eren R.

description:
If I had an extra star to give any restaurant this year, it would go to this place.  One of the coolest dining experiences I have ever had!!!

 The food. OMG the food. It's a journey. It's a melody. I had no idea what was happening through half of it. The layers of ingredients were so varied and intricate, it was hard to keep up. All I know is it worked.  Spicy is the heaven :)

 All in all this is an experience that I recommend for everyone to at least try once. We will most definitely try get go back.
author: Jessica D.

description: Great service. Authentic food. I had the Om Ka chicken with brown rice. Very spicy and flavored well. Friendly staff. This place used to be the old OSHA Thai. It's the same owners though - they renovated adding a touch of class in restaurant fee & food quality as " Lao Table"
author: GB S.

description: Nice decor,  lousy food at a very high price. Soup was inedible.  Get ready for extra employee charge added to the bill.
author: Randall C.

description: My co-worker and I were in the neighborhood and wanted to grab a bite before the weekends. We walked in and was not greeted by anyone, which is fine since it was Friday and they are probably packed for happy hours. A few minutes we were seated and realized how loud the music was. The waitresses were dressed in dark, skimpy dresses and had their boobs hanging out. OK, there were mens next to us and they were both drooling over these waitresses which instead they should have drooled over their foods. All restaurants have different tactics in targeting their customers and this is Lao's- have women dressed in provocative dresses to show off their big boobies and big booties. Since the music was blasting in front of our ears, my co-worker and I decided that we should just grab some appetizers and call it a day. We had quite a challenge trying to talk to each other. I literally had to repeat myself a few times, which made the conversation between us quite awkward. To make matters worst, two random girls came next to us to wait for our seats because they wanted to sit next to their friends whom already started to eat without them. The waitress(es) did nothing and allowed the two random girls to stand next to us while we paid for the bill. The waitress even came over to tell the two random girls " you can have their seats when they leave " Um, excuse me? Talk about rude! For such a high quality restaurant, Lao's Table does not know what courtesy means. We were not done eating or paying and felt completely rushed to LEAVE. So what if we just ordered appetizers and drinks??? This is a restaurant and we're allowed to order whatever we wanted even if it meant without a main course. We felt completely discriminated upon. BUT wait I should understand right? Since after all, restaurants only wants your money and when they have it, they'll kick you out the door for their next customer ...
author: Ohduh H.

description: Wow everything was simply delicious. My friends and I ordered family style to share with crab curry, sausages, duck noodles and basil chicken. The portions were generous for the price and yummy. I would definitely come back again especially for another girls get together!
author: Rainar W.

description:
Pros: Great ambiance, attentive service, flavorful food.
Cons: Overpriced with small portions (3 girls spent $80 per person for dinner)

Appetizers: 
-Zeen Ping: flavorful steak cubes
-Crispy sticky rice salad: plethora of spices, interesting to try

Entrees:
-Suae Hong Hai: all of us thought this was our favorite dish - loved the flavors! sticky rice complemented the steak well
-Khao Poon Crab Curry: not worth it imo, couldn't taste the crab at all so felt like we paid premium for some rice noodles
-Kurobuta Pork Layer: way too salty
-Ka Pow Lamb: usually don't eat lamb but this was a pleasant surprise

Dessert/Drinks:
-Khao Tom Mudd: huge coconut fan here
-Tried Lao Soda (nothing special), French for Coconut (strong w/ nice coconut aftertaste), Pineapple Millionaire (tropical twist - recommend this one)
author: Joyce C.

description: Everything was good! They offered a great variety of delicious dishes as well as drinks! The service was on point! Love the Mango sticky rice dessert!! Will be back again soon!
author: Jacky L.

description: Restaurant serving lunch in the financial area needs to be MUCH more competitive. Restaurant is overpriced. It took a full hour from ordering to being served our dishes (our party was not big - 4 ppl). Food was decent, but it's risky business trying to do a lunch during the work day here - you'll likely be left with 10 mins to inhale your lunch before rushing back to the office. Annoying, given that we didn't even get an apology or offer to remediate.
author: gina n.

description:
OK food but overpriced.

The food was 3 stars. We ordered the pork belly appetizer, a salad (we were initially interested in the bamboo salad but eventually went with the server's recommendation of spicy duck lettuce wrap as she said we might not like the sour taste of the bamboo salad) and the "pad mee" prawns. I'm a big fan of pork belly and have had it in a lot of places including my native Malaysia (also part of SE Asia like Laos), Hong Kong and some other restaurants in New York and SF. This appetizer was mediocre - I find the pork belly too hard and chewy; the dipping sauce was good though. The duck lettuce wrap salad was probably my favorite dish of the three, but at $21.95 it was definitely overpriced. The "pad mee" prawns was similar to pad thai (or fried kuey teow in Malaysia), but with thinner noodles. I liked that it was not overly greasy, but other than that it didn't really stand out. 

Service was 4 stars: In line for this price range. 

Overall, you're definitely paying for the ambiance and location at this place.
author: Mel L.

description: After a rocky first experience during opening week, a group of coworkers and I made a return visit to Lao Table and it appears they have righted the ship. Service was quick, the food was tasty and properly cooked, and we all left in agreement that we enjoyed the experience. I appreciate the overtures from management to give the restaurant another chance.
author: N. F.

description: Incredible, unique place. Laotian food seems to us to be a combination of Vietnamese and Thai cuisine. The variety and combinations are brilliant. The presentation is visually stunning and appetizing. Many of the dishes are quite spicy, but they can accommodate milder palates, as well. If your INTO spicy, however, prepare yourself for an explosion of bliss. We ordered garlic pepper pork, Phō Beef, chicken fried rice, Ka-Pow lamb lollipops, and a dish that looks like shrimp Pad Thai. All were deeply satisfying and vibrant with color.  And, despite what a couple reviewers said, my family felt that portions were large and we were happy to bring home leftovers for lunch the following day!
author: Scott K.

description:
Good portions and good service! My boyfriend and I came here for dinner and weren't disappointed. The timing of our apps and entrees was on point, and service was friendly. Everything was well-flavored and the space is modern and very open. Would definitely return to try more! Highly recommend the pork belly appetizer!

30 min later: Took off two stars due to the fact that we have been waiting 20 min for dessert. They ran our tab in the meanwhile without delay - but still no dessert. We ended up leaving without it. They clearly have a few kinks to work out.
author: Liz L.

description:
We went back to give it another try, and this time, they had Kobe beef as the lunch special ($19.95). So we ordered the Kobe beef, and the roasted chicken (Gai Yaang Ka-Min, $26.95). The dishes were so good. And the portion of chicken was gigantic.
Overall, the dishes were flavorful, just lacking a bit of vegetable.
Also, the salmon from last time has been replaced by a more "standard" salmon dish, but I didn't try it.
We finished with the coconut and banana dessert (Khao Tum Mudd, $11), and really enjoyed it too!
Still a bit pricey for a regular lunch, but we'll definitely come back to try other dishes.
author: Kinder H.

description:
This place is amazing! Price is not bad for the quality of food that you get. They have a lot of cool fun things like the the expanding warm towel tablet and tea that changes color. The service was also excellent.

We tried the calimari, sea bass, red curry, papaya salad and Kobe beef. Everything was spot on. Everything was great but my favorites were the spicey papaya salad and Kobe beef!

I highly recommend this place, you won't be disappointed.
author: Paul K.

description: Had such an amazing time at Lao Table!!! Gorgeous atmosphere and the wait staff was so profession and fast! The food was the best I've had in San Francisco!! I love the manager who is always dressed like a model!!! I will definitely go back!!!!
author: Caroline M.

description: This is my 3rd time here and they never disappoint. Their beef jerky and garlic chicken wings is the bomb!
author: Lynnda T.

description: I took my team here for Christmas dinner party.Love this place,the food is amazing,awesome,delicious,service is excellent,the decor is beautiful. Plenty of seating,very clean environment .The manager is very friendly and nice to all her customers.Highly recommended this gem.
author: Oi L.

description: All of the normal good food, decor, service etc. "Everybody Dance Meow!!" style house music blaring so loud that everyone in the restaurant is yelling at eachother. Don't know whether to order an appetizer or bust out my rave pants and glow sticks.
author: Tim T.

description: Lao used to be one of my regular thai lunch places, I constantly bring guests and groups there. Today I brought a team of 6 and we all waited 30 minutes for our order, mine never came. after 50 minutes I had to cancel my order since I was getting late to a meeting. I got no apology, no questions, not a rewards. What I did get is 20% mandatory gratuity to a table of 6 or more. I left hungry and angry, therefor, 1 star.
author: Effi F.

description: Good food but seemed to be a little over priced. As a vegetarian this place does provide a lot of options. Many of the meat dishes have a vegetarian option available on request.
author: Kelsey C.

description: Excellent service and the food is even more amazing. I'm from Laos and the food here was definitely nostalgic for me. Lao Table exceeded my expectations!
author: Phousone S.

description: The atmosphere is fancy and cozy. Great find and i will definitely be back. I would probably come every week for Friday Happy hours $1 oyster. It is fresh and reasonable price. The bartender is cute and friendly too. Cute Thai Girl and pretty smile.
author: Fifa C.

description: It was my second time here. Still got delicious food and great service. Server and manager was friendly. This place is definitely worth visiting. Will come back again soon. Love Tum Marg Hoong!!!! Yummy!!!
author: Phanpichaya S.

description: Yesterday, I came here for lunch with my friend.  Everything was really good!! Great foods. Service was nice and quick. Also, plating was beautiful! I was impressed. I recommend this place.
author: Ye Won J.

description: Great experience overall. Basil chicken was very good and spicy. The restaurant is fantasy and romantic. My server was very clearly and speak Spanish. She know the menu very well. I had amazing experience. Make me feel like a guest in her home. Looking forward to returning here back soon. Muy delicioso!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jose E.

description: Nice ambience and convenient location near market street, SOMA and Financial District. This place was Osha Thai in the past and has changed its name now. Good was average. Pretty mild in flavor compared with what I'd expect in a real Thai restaurant. Everything here is just ok, not bad not great.
author: Vin M.

description: Good food nice decor. I ordered Koi tuna and crispy sticky rice salad to share with my friends. They are so delicious. Must have mango stick rice for desert.
author: May L.

description: Delicious!  A little pricey, but well worth it!  Been here twice in two weeks, and will definitely be back again :)
author: Qui F.

description: What an absolutely incredible restaurant!! The food is simply amazing, and I would know since my girlfriend is from the Thailand region next to Laos! To To'p it off, the shaved ice dessert is amuse!!!
author: Mayura I.

description: Came here for dinner with my friend. We ordered "Totally Prawns" and "Khaw Kai" Noodles. Both of them are delicious! Great food, good services and comfortable environment!
author: Ocean N.

description: Amazing food, beautiful decor, great drinks commandeered by legit bar manager, sports on multiple TVs...
author: Mel W.

description:
I went here with a bunch of friends when we were visiting San Francisco for a conference. It was possibly the most memorable meal of our entire trip!

Not only was the service top tier, but the quality and quantity of food was also at least two standard deviations about the average. When one member of our group accidentally ordered an extremely spicy dish. They immediately offered complementary Thai tea. When it was still too spicy they exchanged the dish without question.

I highly recommend that you try their Khao Nar Ped (tasty honey duck with rice). Also if you're not too full, consider sharing a Mango Sticky Rice. It comes with a huge tower of shaved mango ice!
author: Chris L.

description: The chicken and rice plate I got was OK but pricey for the small lunch portions.
author: Rahul H.

description: The waitstaff were very accommodating and the food was delicious. I got the pork belly, which was very moist and tender. The mango sticky rice was great, too, and the coconut condensed milk poured over the mango was fragrant and just sweet enough.
author: Garrett C.

description: Fantastic experience with excellent service. They easily seated our large party and took great care of all of us. They even switched out a dish that was too spicy for someone with no questions asked. The food as well as the service was above and beyond. I would highly recommend!
author: Ben J.

description: Awesome experience. Interesting subtle flavors, lots of fresh herbs and veggies which I loved and reminded me of my of Laos. Also generously spicy, even for the mild dishes. The sticky rice salad was very tasty and the mountainous size mango sticky rice dessert was sumptuous. Although my partner didn't appreciate it, the highlight of the evening for me was the durian icy dessert. Any restaurants brave enough to have durian on their menu deserves a thumbs up. Be adventurous and enjoy!
author: Kathleen V.

description: New to try this restaurant and am sooo happy I came! We have a mix of vegetarians and meat lovers and Lao Table accommodated us all with delicious food, wonderful service and gorgeous decor. The waiters and waitresses were super attentive and so nice. Food came out quickly and was delicious! I ordered the spicy eggplant and it did not disappoint! Am definitely coming back here again! #happybelly
author: Daphne M.

description:
I took some out of town friends to Lao Table last night based on the many good reviews on yelp and foodie boards. My guests come from London and Bangkok, and we were all very pleased.
FOOD:  Great!  Our table started with 4 appetizers. I loved the Sai Oua (northern Thai sausage), reminiscent of my favorite snack when I to Chiang Mai, and hands down the best in SF.  Nicely fragrant, and good balance of lean pork meat and fat.  The wings, hanger steak ,and the tuna tartare-like a raw tuna larb,  where all tasty and beautifully presented.
Our mains were equally as tasty.  OMG the pork knuckle! I wanted it all to myself.  Slow braised in a dark rich five-spice sauce with condiments.  The Mok Seabass also surprised me.  A nice play on Ho Mok, very big and balanced fish custard. 
Although we were very full we did order some light desserts.  The mango ice and rice and then the Thai tea ice-cream and ice. Both light, slightly sweet and refreshing.
SERVICE: Great! Immediately greeted at the door and taken to our table.  I don't think we ever lacked for attention and service during our whole stay.  It seemed that we were serviced by many staff, and if anyone saw that we looked quizzical, or needed something the closest staff helped us.
ATMOSPHERE:  The restaurant is very well decorated, comfortable, modern, and spacy.  What I really appreciated was the bathrooms. Living in SF I have become accustom to having one old bathroom to accommodate the entire restaurant, however at Lao, it seems that the management invested all accommodations for customers in their remodel.  Never did I have to wait for the bathroom with a full restaurant.  There were three, maybe for bathrooms, all nicely appointed and clean. I did appreciate the different soaps and lotions.
author: OneOfTwo F.

description: I had a great time here! I ordered the Spicy Steak Lao and it was absolutely delicious. Good food + good friends = good times
author: Olivia O.

description: The food and service is very good i has the crispy sticky rice,red curry chicken and mak mango for dessert i really love it.
author: V'View K.

description: Went there for lunch had a great experience and the food was amazing. We shared vegetable spring rolls it was good. I had the lamb chops they where served with brown rice and spicy basil sauce it was delicious. My husband had a leg of chicken with a curry sauce it was off the special menu he really enjoyed it. We finished the meal off by having desert I highly recommend this one it was the chocolate cake. I will most definitely be back.
author: Haydee F.

description:
We visited Lao Table on a Thursday at 7:30pm. Recommend getting a reservation as it seemed pretty busy. The decor was very contemporary and casual and what you would expect out of a trendy Asian Fusion restaurant. We enjoyed the service as the wait staff was very friendly and did a good job explaining each dish as it came out. The menu itself was very long, which is great as it includes something for everyone (and a few adventurous dishes), but was also difficult to choose from. We ended up ordering the following:

- Lao sausage: 4/5; tasty and interesting
- Moo Nam Pla (Fried Pork Belly): 4/5; flavorful and crispy, yet still juicy
- Crispy Sticky Rice Salad: 4.5/5; favorite dish, spicy and eaten with a variety of veggies/lettuce wraps
- Om Chicken (chicken curry): 2/5; would not recommend, very forgettable 
- Gai Yaang Ka-Min (chicken with tumeric and papaya salad): 3/5; tender, skin is the best past; papaya salad was a bit disappointing as it was relatively flavorless
- Thai iced teas: 3/5; unmemorable 

Overall: interesting meal (apps were definitely the highlight), but overpriced (came out to $170 for 3)
author: Calvin H.

description: They were great as OSHA Thai. Now, the food is really bad-- tastes like overpriced food court Chinese. The service is non existent.
author: Ro G.

description: Service was excellent. She was very friendly and always came back to check on us. She also refilled our drinks without having to be asked. We've ordered 3 dishes and all 3 was amazing. The steak melts in your mouth if you order it medium rare and if you like it on the harder side, you should order medium well. The drink was good but I think a bigger glass would be nice. Overall the restaurant was great!
author: Zech V.

description:
Went to a company happy hour in the lounge. They had $3 drinks and southeast asian street food for bar snacks! House made sai ua pork sausage with lemongrass, lime leaf, and galangal? Pure heaven.

Decided to stay for dinner and got the duck larb and authentic Laos-style tham mak hoong papaya salad with crab legs and padaek. Extravagant flavors, portions, presentation, and setting. Can't wait to come back with 10 friends to do family style and try everything!
author: Adam F.

description: Probably the worst Thai/Laotian I've ever had. Ordered the PAD MOO-PA for lunch and it truly gave a bad name to Kurobuta. The pork was cut poorly and could hardly be chewed. The spice was primarily the peppercorns that overwhelmed the dish. Definitely not worth the money. Super pricey for what it is. If I wasn't with a group, I would have sent the dish back.
author: Wennerz C.

description:
Easily my favorite dining experience in San Francisco. It's delicious! It's an experience! There's your summary.

 I went for a friend's dinner a few weeks back. The interior is very interesting and upscale.

 Staff is incredibly friendly. They stop chatter to explain and serve each dish to the few dozen people dining, which I kind of enjoyed.
author: KaoOat L.

description:
Love love love this spot. 

I take myself here about once a month for a treat. My go tos are the Zeen Ping (beautifully seasoned steak with a sauce so good, I would bathe in it) and the Lao Soda (a sweet kafir lime and watermelon cocktail, that's a perfectly mixed vacation in a glass)

Highly recommend.
author: Fiona F.

description: Cute place. Friendly servers. Fresh food. Creative menu. Great drinks! A little noisy. We'll be back.
author: Robin A.

description: The food is very tasty and great. The interior is very unique and clean. I strongly recommend you to have Mark Mango for your dessert.
author: Derek S.

description:
We stopped by for dinner on Friday without reservation and got seated within 10 minutes.  It has a full menu with appetizers, salads, starch and meat. And yes, there is a full bar.
We had the spring rolls and pork belly. Both were yummy but small portions. For a group of 6, you would need 2 orders of each. We didn't family style with Lao fried rice, eggplant and beef lettuce wrap. The fried rice and eggplants were ok, nothing too special. The beef lettuce wrap was very salty and spicy. 
The restaurant is an open rectangular place. The noice level was loud. 
Our waitress took our order within 15 minutes. The food started to trickle out another 20 minutes later. We had ordered the flank steak but we never got the dish. We asked for our waters to be refilled repeatedly since the food is very salty. It took another good 20-30 minutes for our waitress to bring the check. This after we flagged her down. 
Overall, the food was tasty but the service brought down the rating.
author: Mary C.

description: The food is amazing! I came here with 9 of my friends and basically ordered the whole menu my favorite dishes are the pork belly, koi tuna, and Tom yum Lao!
author: Richard C.

description: Great tasting food. Good location for lunch or dinner on weekdays. A bit overpriced, however. Service is a hit or miss, but most of the times it was good.
author: R A.

description: This was such a great place with a different flavor and presentation than expected.  The staff seated us immediately and someone came by to answer questions and take our orders.  The menu had a large variety from salads to soups to rice, noodle and curry dishes.  We tried several dishes and were pleased with them all. The Lao rice was slightly spicy with a nice sweetness from the pineapple to cool it off.  The red curry was fresh with a nice mix of fresh peppers.  I would recommend the beef lettuce wraps if you like heat.  If not, ask them to cool it down.  Don't order sodas- warm and flat.  The service was good but you had multiple staff so not clear who was assisting you.  Thus it took awhile to get check.  It fills up quick.  We hit a sweet spot at 11:45 but when we left, it was packed!
author: Kim G.

description: Food was ok, service was terrible. My food came 12 minutes after the other two diners I was with, and was not as described in the menu.
author: lindsey s.

description: This was an excellent choice for me to have lunch . They have a nice menu. The food here is amazing . The dishes are well prepared with a beautiful presentation.
author: Jamon P.

description:
I was thoroughly pleased with the new decor of Lao Table, in the old Osha Thai space! I am thrilled to see there is a proper bar/lounge for happy hour! I really enjoyed the cuisine at Lao Table. The server was very good at describing all the dishes we inquired about. He made sure to let us know what dishes were classic cuisine from Laos, as I have not had that country's cuisine, until now. Delicious, fresh flavors served in a very creative presentation. 
Mariah Zuefle Newman
author: Mariah Z.

description: City price for Asian food... good attentive service, nice modern like others comment. The beef appetizer was good and the mango shaved ice with mochi was fun to share with my kids before the baseball game. Will explore other places next time in the city.
author: Maya S.

description: Ordered the spicy chicken bowl. Not something I'd go back for. My colleague ordered lamb chops and he loved it.
author: Amit K.

description: The ambiance is fine as a Soma lunch place for either a group or table for 2. The tamarind beef was a disappointment.  Many pieces were as tough as chewing gum and we sat around watching each other chew.  The rest of the meal was pricey for what it is, but is the norm in this neighborhood.  At the end of the meal, we were waiting for the bill.  It was towards the end of lunch service and some tables had emptied out.  We found it odd that the staff was spending a lot of time cleaning and resetting the empty tables when there were no more patrons coming in.  In the meantime, tables with patrons waiting to finish and get back to work were being ignored.  Friendly service aside from that.
author: ange c.

description: I was excited to try this "new" Lao restaurant out. Traveling a lot I crave Lao food at time. When we are in SF we have usually spot that we go to in the tenderloin. I called in my order for Lao style papaya salad spicy. On the call I asked the guy if he was true Lao style. He said yes it also comes with the salted crab leg and sticky rice.  $22 for papaya salad is pretty pricey but of course I wanted to support the "Lao food movement." When my husband came back to the hotel with my order it there was no sticky rice, no salted crab, and the taste of the papaya salad was Thai style. I called the restaurant, the Manager kept saying if you ordered it "Lao" style it would be. I'm like I did . My receipt even says Lao style. She apologized for not having the sticky rice but for the rest of the part she made it sound like I didn't know how to order my food. She said if I ever went there again she would make sure I get it the Lao style. But honestly I don't think I would ever go there. I don't mind paying for food as long as it's good. I was better off going to our usual spot and paying 6.00 for my papaya salad and sticky rice.
author: Vinai D.

description: tomahawk steak????? where your tomahawk steak!  had me come here and don't have that on menu..  don't post pictures of dishes you don't offer... that how you can get low score on yelp.
author: Kwong M.

description: Good food, great service, nice ambient and the price wasn't bad for the quality. The crispy rice salad and tamarind beef was phenomenal. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes.
author: Gam T.

description: Good service. Foods have balanced flavors & good portions. The restaurant is quite busy so you should book a table for any group bigger than 3.
author: Nguyet N.

description: First time - delicious! Attractive space and food is outstanding. Will be back...
author: molly c.

description: Love this place so much. The design is very fancy and modern. Food is delicious, excellent customer service. Overall very good atmosphere.
author: Jazzy S.

description: Lao Table has such a good food and service. The manager her name is Kitty she so nice. We would love to come back here again for some good food and service, love this place .
author: Jeab A.

description: Love this place.It's so beautiful inside!! Delicious food and decents prices for what you get.I agree with a previous reviewer that Lao table is an upgrade from Osha Thai!! Will definitely be back!!
author: Aommy A.

description: Authentic Thai E-sarn/ Laotian food with modern atmosphere. We did order Suae Hong Hai pairing with Bodegas Zapata Malbec, it was fantastic. We also ordered Laotian style Papaya salad set with BBQ chicken; it really reminds me of the taste of home.
author: RtsuBJ F.

description:
We had an early reservation at 5:45 during happy hour, so they let us order a couple happy hour appetizers and drinks at our table.  $1 oysters with a great sauce.  I loved the garlicy, sweet and tart chicken wings.  We had the fried rice salad and the Bamboo salad - both are lettuce wraps.  They asked what degree of spice, and my husband said medium.  Remember Thai medium is like Mexican hot.  I liked both salads, but the heat of the bamboo salad caught up with me.  We shared shrimp red curry, flat noodles, hanger steak with eggplant.  All were delicious.  The hanger steak and eggplant was especially sweet, but I like it that way.  To end we did the Mango ice with sticky rice/mangos.  4
People shared it and there were left overs.  Very refreshing, think mango snow one with syrup to the bottom.  With 3 glasses of wine and a Thai ice tea it was about $170.   So I'd say it's more of a $$$ instead of $$.  It's beautifully decorated and the service was good.  The salad came out at the same time as the main dishes, and I wish there was a little more time between dishes.  I'd definitely return.
I forgot to add, reservations weren't necessary for an early dinner on a Friday night.  The decor is modern and the washrooms very clean.  Love that.
author: Berles C.

description: Yesssss! Get the lao jito and look up the oyster happy hour! worth it.  A must visit and I'm coming back. :)
author: Dan N.

description: The food was fresh and tasty. The duck leg appetizer is amazing! I had the flank steak with tamarind sauce and eggplant. The sauce was a bit too sweet for my liking, but the eggplant was luscious. Others had noodle dishes which looked very appealing. We also shared the mango shaved ice for dessert, which was a tower of fluffy orange sweetness, very refreshing. The service was great, very attentive. I will go back.
author: Kathy E.

description: Came here last minute for a birthday dinner.  Great, warm and friendly ambiance and service.  We had the pork belly, pad mee and multiple desserts (mark mango and tom mudd).  Happiness all around:-)
author: christine l.

description: Perfection.  The Osha team created a beautiful space with meticulous attention to detail --- lowered the volume of the music and accented the walls and ceiling with custom fabric to tone down the noise for good conversation.  Excellent service and delicious foods with exotic spices and lovely presentation.
author: W D.

description: This place is not a Lao restaurant. It's got maybe 3-4 Lao dishes but that's it. It's very very similar to the old OSHA. It's also ridiculously overpriced. Twenty something dollars for bland pho chicken? Some dishes like the pork belly and sausage rolls are delicious, but it's not worth to come back and pay top $$$$ for food that Lers Ros and Saap Ver can give more for this kind of prices.
author: Hoang T.

description: First of all, this is Thai food not Laotian. Secondly, it's ridiculously overpriced simply because it's in SF and in the financial district. Not because it's that good or authentic. $12 for 4 Thai rice paper rolls?! I'd rather pay for an Uber and take myself to the Tenderloin where there's much better and more authentic Lao and Thai food. WTH. Never coming back. Service is decidedly not at par with the sky-high prices.
author: Mick J.

description: Great restaurant! Went for a birthday that night and they happened to have a live Thai band. We got there a little early and there is NO space to wait anywhere. Sadly if you get a drink at the bar there is no where to go to drink it since they seat people at the bar (they will make you leave). Buuuut the food and service when you get a table was pretty great. The Tom Yum soup was amazing. Their medium is pretty spicy for the soup so be warned. Their yellow curry was pretty good too.
author: Jonathan S.

description: At first when my gf and I came in I thought we were to dresssed down for this place, but we were ok. The servers were quick and very friendly. I forgot to take pictures of the plates we had but one was a simple noodle dish with some pork or pork shoulder and our other plate was a pork belly in a tamarind sauce that resembled curry. For dessert we had the snow mike? I think. It was shaved ice with mango purée and on the side was sticky rice with mango. My only knock is that I wish we had more of the sticky rice and mango because that's my gf and I favorite but beggars can't be choosers. Overall I was surprised by this place because we just yelped it before going over to kaskade. Don't hesitate to try, compared to other places the food felt really authentic.
author: Joseph N.

description: I decided to give this place a try since Osha changed the format to a "Laotian" restaurant and did a small refurbishment of the interior and menu (jacked up prices).  I've noticed the place is not as jammed pack as in the Osha days, when the pushy wait staff would aggressively encourage table turnover.  Well I soon figured out why it is no longer full at lunch. Was ushered to a crammed in table promptly at 1150. Ordered. Waited 15 minutes and no food.  20 mins. No food. 30 minutes no food.  People next to us also waiting 35 minutes. After 35 minutes, could not find staff to enquire about food ETA.  After 40 minutes got up and left.   I am never patronizing an Osha again and I look forward to their early demise.  Too much coasting on their laurels.  My new favorite Thai place in SF is Thai Farmers Market in the Multimedia gulch of inner mission.  Vastly superior food, service and price.
author: Dean P.

description: Closest thing to authentic Lao food. Sausage and shaved ice with mango syrup...highly recommend it!
author: Savia S.

description: Came here for a work lunch. Had their noodles, which were authentic and light. Their desserts were unique yet AMAZING!
author: Taylor D.

description: Visiting from out of town, loved this place.  Ordered khao poon and bamboo salad (acquired taste) - yummy, will be back tomorrow.
author: See L.

description: For a busy Friday, service was good, food arrived promptly, the Mark Mango is great, and the Lao fried rice is awesome.
author: Lana L.

description: Small portions, big prices, slow service. The food had a lot of flavor, and the drinks were strong, but I'm pretty sure my Pho was served with wheat noodles instead of rice noodles, and the broth was served on the side. Who does that? Also, the broth was too salty, and there wasn't nearly enough. Would not eat there again.
author: Andrea A.

description: Loved the food and service at this restaurant!  Be prepared as some of the food can be pretty spicy.  I would recommend for people looking to try something interesting.
author: Artee L.

description:
This place takes Thai food to a new level.  The service is fantastic, the go above and beyond. My mouth has been exposed to out of this world flavors, the spices used are combined to perfection. A unique food experience that cannot be explained with a review. I will sleep very good tonight. And if I die tomorrow I could die in peace!
Also the decor makes it feel very peaceful and zen. You can tell management has put a great effort to make it a special place to dine. Great find!
author: Daniel B.

description: Decor was great, food was very good. The place hasn't been open a week yet so service was a little clumsy, but friendly, not a lot to complain about. I preferred when it was OSHA...one of my favorite Thai food restaurants. I hope Lao lives up to OSHA, hard act to follow. We'll be back.
author: Mike G.

description: Pho is flavorless. Fried duck wings are too fat. Fried rice is OK. Overall, it's a restaurant that I won't visit back again.
author: Jenny Z.

description: slightly overpriced for the portion sizes, but overall a cool vibe and tasty food. Got the pineapple fried rice and really enjoyed it.
author: Chris S.

description: Visiting San Francisco and was craving some Thai food. The Fresh spring rolls were amazing. The fried rice was good (nothing crazy spectacular though). Would recommend. The atmosphere is really great though. Very clean and super friendly staff.
author: Lindsey D.

description: Great food and atmosphere.  Server knew the menu (thank you) and the service was great. Plenty of options and authentic with their own twist.
author: Mike B.

description: Waaay overpriced, especially for lunch.  After a 15% tip and no drink I paid over $23 for a rice bowl that barely had any rice, and they wanted to charge me $4 extra to add a little rice, which would have made it almost $30 for a rice bowl with no drink and a bare mimimum tip!!  Nice ambience though amd profitable location.  Service was efficient and fast, but extremely transactional and emotionally cold.  Food was fairly tasty, but way too salty.  Napkins were VERY nice.
author: james b.

description: Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious and was presented beautifully.  I haven't had a lot of Laotian cuisine, so I'm excited to go back and continue exploring the menu.  The decor is also very elegant.
author: Robb K.

description: The food was delicious, the staff were pleasantly nice, and they gave us free dessert on Friday!
author: Austin N.

description: I do recommend this restaurant. They provide various kinds of food that i can't find in other Thai restaurants. I can request level of spice. All food that I ordered taste amazing The owner and servers deliver great service. The restaurant itself has a nice decoration. Highly recommended!
author: PeaRy E.

description:
Easily 5 stars all around, both food and services.

Staffs are very knowledgable about their food. Let them make recommendations and wait for a big surprise.

The flavor is really authentic, spicy and flavorful.

Staffs are very attentive. You'll feel pampered all then way from table setting, water pouring, friendly services, and so on.

I really appreciate when one of the server suggest I try some dish over the other one because "it's not that good"

I would definitely come back here again~ highly recommended.
author: Nelson L.

description: The tamarind beef and curry chicken were excellent.  The pork belly appetizer wasn't bad.  A little disappointed with the spring rolls
author: Angry M.

description: Delicious. Many veggie options. Tasty chicken curries. Free dessert if you review on yelp :)
author: Anand S.

description: This is my second time here. I am very impressed about the services. All staff are really nice and foods are tasty. Recommended!!!
author: KungKing K.

description: Very nice location, the decor and lighting are just right, giving the restaurant a pleasant vibe. I had never been to a Laotian restaurant before and left very pleased, the rice seemed to come alive with the sauces that come with the dishes, the spicyness giving it a kick. We also had the Tom Yum Koong and really liked the complexity of the hot and sour flavor.
author: Laura W.

description: Great service excellent and unique and creative dishes. I recommend ordering family style so if you are with a group you can really sample more dishes. Highly recommended.
author: John W.

description: Awesome!  Came here for a work holiday party.  Attentive service.   Lao sausage is wonderfully spiced and the kapow lamb was amazing!  Check it out!
author: Jo F.

description: We dined here recently for a friend's birthday. Very nice restaurant. Nice and calming atmosphere, great customer service, food was delicious, presentation of food was beautiful, and pretty restrooms. The "birthday cake" was this durian flavored shaved ice with other interesting tastes. It was served on a wooden tray with a single candle. Before it came out, the manager hit the gong and then the servers burst into a birthday song! Such a thoughtful and beautiful presentation. The best part was that they didn't charge us for the "cake". So sweet! Definitely will be back here for more yummy food and the service!
author: Anonymous M.

description: I would certainly not recommend lao table based solely on the service. We called ahead and were told that the restaurant could seat our party. However, when we arrived, we were told the restaurant was closed - despite arriving well in advance of the published closing time. In addition, the staff was very condescending when we arrived. Will not go back.
author: James L.

description: Came here again for lunch. Kept it simple and had the Lao Steak and iced coffee (If you're going to work out later like I was, there is nothing better). Steak was cooked perfectly and the mushroom and vegetable side was juicy and delicious. Sticky rice with steak is actually a great combination. If you come here with a group and you're not food adventurous, you can't go wrong with this order! Highly recommended.
author: Harve M.

description: I met a friend here for a weekday night dinner. The food was unusual, delicious and spicy! Convenient downtown location and nice ambiance with bright decor and high ceilings. Lao Table is great if you're looking for solid portions and something different.
author: Haley Y.

description: First look is very nice but The food doesn't taste good. The noodle is too sweet. Meat is dry. Disappointed.
author: Hai L.

description: The food is amazing and so is the service! Ordered the pork belly and it was the best I've ever had! Would have left a picture but I ate it up too fast, it looked so good! Also had the Lao sausage as an appetizer and everyone at the table loved it.
author: Zachary R.

description: Great place for a group get together!!! Great ambiance, nice service--- although they did forget a few of our orders.   Interesting delicious food--- we loved the squid appetizers, several of the noodle dishes    Drinks were good--- with full bar.  Their deserts were immense!
author: N S.

description: I ordered the Pad Mee Prawns. It was delicious. Also tried the Koi Tuna appetizer and was not disappointed. My friend ordered the red curry chicken.  She loved it. Our server was friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable. Beautiful decor!!Will definitely be back.
author: A L.

description: the presentation was beautiful, the food tasted good, the Ahi Tuna could have been a little more fresh but it was still good. the service was great.
author: Hana F.

description: Terrific service and nice decor. Chicken satay yummy, but the green papaya salad was spectacular!!! (I got it w/ chicken which was tender tho not very flavorful). The Kobe beef was also mouthwateringly tasty. A Singha beer washed it all down nicely. Only complaint was the prices - on the high side.
author: Olivia M.

description: We are a great fan of Thai cuisine and have tried many different places in SF. We went to Lao Table with our friends for lunch and we all loved it. It has a nice ambiance and fantastic food, the staff are very kind and helpful. Will be back for sure!
author: Live H.

description: The food is great, the ambiance is good, but the service is meh.
author: Faun W.

description: $19 at lunch for a small bowl of okay Tom Yum Goong without noodles?
author: M S.

description: I went here for a dinner during my birthday week with a former colleague and his girlfriend. I gauge every Thai or Lao restaurant based on the authenticity of its papaya salad ("tum mak hoong"). Lao Table does not disappoint - the salad was deliciously spicy and the portion was impressive. My only issue was that my entree (I ordered the Tiger Steak) arrived well after everyone received their orders. My friends were even finished eating when I was only a few bites into my steak. I've worked in the restaurant industry before, so I notice how busy a server is and other tables around me. I give passes for things that would easily piss other people off and 20% is my standard tip unless I see you actually spit in my food. I'm pretty sure my server forgot to place the order and she told me that they had to "remake the steak because it was overcooked when it was about it come out" (I ordered it medium rare). It was my birthday but I wasn't born yesterday. Anyway, an apology and the truth would have been sufficient, but it seems that "gullible" is stamped on my forehead. Thankfully, I had the yummy papaya salad to pick at while my friends ate their meals. Would I book a dinner party here? Probably not. Would I return for the food with lower expectations of the service? Sure. Also, it was really cute that the American host nops and greeted us with "sabai dee" - it made me smile.
author: Vasana S.

description: I enjoyed my meals. Soft drinks are little pricey. Papaya salad is great but really spicy. Dessert is good. Really recommend this Lao restaurant. Service is wonderful.
author: T L.

description: Amazing taste, amazing service, stellar ambience, price is right for cheaper items. Definitely a regular visitor :)
author: Steve L.

description: Very poor options for vegetarians. All curries contain fish sauce. Their "wok" dishes (mixed vegetables and eggplant) contain oyster sauce. I asked that they be made vegetarian, which they obliged but was lacking in flavor. And one of the rice bowls that was supposed to be made vegan for me had some chicken! I won't be going back!
author: Sriram G.

description: Fine selection of Laotian classics, well executed. In a word Delicious! Service a bit spotty and slow, but I attribute that to growing pains. beautiful decor, but tables are a bit close together.
author: Alan Y.

description: Great food, good quantity and an amazing decor. Very warm and welcoming place!
author: Megha P.

description: Been here twice and will certainly be back in my next trip to SF. The food is great and very generous portions. Jennifer at the bar is very accommodating and made some excellent recommendations.
author: J K.

description: Prices are absolutely outrageous.  Food and service were fine but nothing outstanding or that would in any way warrant FIVE DOLLARS for a six-ounce Coke, or TWENTY DOLLARS for a papaya salad.  $4.50 for rice?  Seriously??  Sure it's downtown SF but this is ridiculous.  There are way better places in the area.  I expect all the high reviews are Elite Yelpers who had their meals comped.
author: Jay O.

description: Loved the menu with so many innovative options and the place had a really nice vibe, decor, and music.
author: Laura K.

description: I had been here many time because my family very like food at Lao Table!!! .I hop i will come back to eat here again and again!!
author: Celine P.

description: The food was fresh, flavorful and delicious!  We had the red curry, spicey duck, Me Ka Ti and everyone loved their dishes.  Service was sharp and presentation of food lovely
author: Karen S.

description: The hot toddy is out of this world! This was my second visit and they improved which I didn't think was possible.  The duck the first visit was flavorful and cooked to perfection. The prawns this visit we're the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. The portions are large so bring your appetite. The atmosphere is distinctly authentic and lively.  Definitely a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Ilicia Maxine R.

description: Came here for happy hour, I must say they have some of the best prices here for HH and the food is amazing. This place is the same as OSHA, but they have a new food menu and it is amazing. Get the wings for happy hour they are amazing, get the sausage, so many flavors, get the coconut soup and it will rock your world. The food here has always been the best, I don't know why they get 3.5 stars, perhaps people don't know what to order but the pad Thai and the soup is amazing.
author: Sergio G.

description: Don't order the sea bass. It is really bad. The dishes don't have vegetables. The service was very good. The food was delicious.
author: Mary E.

description: Lao Table is the most delicious,modern,and gourmet Laotian foods with an excellent atmosphere & services ! We came for company holiday lunch with the group of 20. By the time , we arrived , we ready to enjoy having delicious foods with luxury welcome & services from Kitty, manager. Strongly recommend!
author: Lilly Z.

description: Ordered mild duck laab and lao sausage. The duck laab was very spicy for a mild version which overpowered other seasonings. Too expensive for what the size. Lao sausage was tasty with small portions. The setting was very nice. Not authentic Lao food.
author: Jade T.

description: this place is amazing i order cripy rice salad Anyway as far as food goes holy wow. i love it.
author: Yupaporn W.

description: They just reopen for Lao cuisine, but still own by Osha Thai. Always love Osha food. Love Gai Yaang Ka-Min. It tastes pretty well with papaya salad and Moo Nam Pla.
author: Benji H.
